FULL_ADDRESS: 136 Tremont St Central Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxxx on Friday, xxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxx (xxxxx) and Officer xxxxxx (xxxxx) received a radio call for a motor vehicle accident with a pedestrian located at xxx Tremont St, Boston. Officers were assisted by Superintendent xxxxxxx (xxx), Deputy Superintendent xxxxxxxxx (xxxx), Lieutenant xxxxxxxxxx (xxxx) and Officer xxxxx (xxxxx).

On arrival, Officers observed a white xxxx Nissan xxxxxxxxxx (MA REG: xxxxxx, VIN: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) parked in the left lane in front of xxx Tremont St. 

Officers observed a white male (later identified as xxx xxxxxxxx) laying in the left lane of Tremont St, in front of the Nissan xxxxxxxxxx, being attended to by Boston EMS (xxx: xxxxxxxxxxxxx). 

Officers observed Boston Fire Department (xxx and xxx) on scene. 

Officer xxxxxx spoke with xxxxxxxx, who was alert and conscious. Officer xxxxxx did not observe any visible injuries. xxxxxxxx stated that the right side of his back was sore. 

xxxxxxxx stated that he was riding his bicycle in the left lane of Tremont St. As he passed a white Nissan xxxxxxxxxx, his right handlebar got xxxxxx onto the motor vehicle. xxxxxxxx could not xxxxxxxx his handlebar from the motor vehicle. xxxxxxxx stated that the handlebar of his bicycle turned in towards the motor vehicle and then he flipped over his handlebars. xxxxxxxx landed on the hood of the motor vehicle and then fell onto the roadway. xxxxxxxx stated that he believed the motor vehicle was traveling about xx MPH. xxxxxxxx was not wearing a helmet.

A friend of xxxxxxxx took custody of his bicycle. 

Boston EMS transported xxxxxxxx to New xxxxxxx Medical Center for further evaluation.

Officers spoke with the operator of the white Nissan xxxxxxxxxx. He was identified as xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx (xxx: xxxxxxxx, MA xxx: xxxxxxxxx). xxxxxxx informed officers that he was in the left lane on Tremont St rolling about x MPH when the bicyclist came from behind and then collided with his motor vehicle. 

The passenger inside the white Nissan xxxxxxxxxx was identified as xxxxxx xxxxxx (xxx: xxxxxxxx). xxxxxx stated that he believed the motor vehicle was going about x MPH when he observed the bicycle's handlebar xxxxx xxxxxxxxx and then hit the motor vehicle. 

Officers observed scuff marks on the front driver's side quarter panel of the Nissan xxxxxxxxxx.

Officers spoke with witnesses on scene. 

Officer xxxxxx spoke with xxxxxx Spokes who stated that the bicycle came from behind the motor vehicle and then collided with the motor vehicle. 

Officer xxxxxx spoke with xxx xxxxxxxx who observed xxxxxxxx land on top of the hood of the motor vehicle and then slide down onto the pavement. 

No citations were issued.

FULL_ADDRESS: 746 Huntington Ave Jamaica Plain , MA, USA
Narrative:
ABOUT xxxxxx ON xxxxxx, xxxxxxxxx P.O. xxxxxxx WHILE ASSIGNED TO THE xxxxx RESPONDED TO A RADIO CALL FOR A M/V ACCIDENT AT HUNTINGTON xxxxxxxxxxx RD IN MISSION HILL.
ON ARRIVAL, THE OFFICER SPOKE WITH THE VICTIM (F. xxxxxxxx) WHO EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS RIDING HER BICYCLE TRAVELING OUTBOUND ON HUNTINGTON AVE AND AS SHE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxxx RD, SHE OBSERVED THE ABOVE LISTED M/V (MA REG # xxxxxx - xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx) TRAVELING IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION ON HUNTINGTON AVE AND ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A LEFT FROM HUNTINGTON AVE ONTO xxxxxxx RD.  THE VICTIM TOLD THE OFFICER THAT AS SHE APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION, SHE OBSERVED THE M/V SLOWLY TURNING THROUGH THE INTERSECTION HOWEVER, SHE DID NOT STOP BECAUSE SHE HAD THE RIGHT OF WAY AND SHE THOUGHT THE M/V WAS GOING TO STOP AND ALLOW HER TO PROCEED.  THE VICTIM STATED THAT AS THE M/V CONTINUED FORWARD AND GOT CLOSER TO HER, SHE ATTEMPTED TO MANEUVER AWAY FROM THE M/V AND HIT THE CURB CAUSING HER TO FALL TO THE GROUND.  THE VICTIM REPORTED THAT SHE THINKS THE M/V STRUCK HER BICYCLE BEFORE SHE RODE INTO THE CURB HOWEVER, SINCE IT HAPPENED SO FAST SHE WAS ABOUT "xx xxxxxxx SURE."  THE VICTIM SHOWED THE OFFICER VISIBLE INJURIES THAT SHE SUSTAINED AS A RESULT OF THE ACCIDENT, WHICH CONSISTED OF xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx TO THE AREA OF HER RIGHT HIP.  THE OFFICER ALSO CHECKED THE VICTIM'S BIKE, WHICH APPEARED UNDAMAGED AND THE OFFICER DID NOT OBSERVE ANY INDICATION THAT IT HAD BEEN STRUCK BY THE M/V.  THE VICTIM WAS SUBSEQUENTLY TRANSPORTED BY EMS AMBULANCE # xxxx (xxxxxxxxxxxxxx) TO BRIGHAM & WOMEN'S HOSPITAL FOR EVALUATION/TREATMENT OF INJURIES SUSTAINED N THE ACCIDENT.  THE VICTIM'S BOYFRIEND (E. xxxxxxxx) WAS AT THE SCENE AND HE TOOK CUSTODY OF THE VICTIM'S BICYCLE.  THE OFFICER ALSO SPOKE WITH THE OPERATOR (J. xxxxxxxx) OF THE ABOVE LISTED M/V WHO EXPLAINED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING INBOUND ON HUNTINGTON AVE AND ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A LEFT TURN ONTO xxxxxxx RD WHEN HE OBSERVED THE VICTIM RIDING HER BICYCLE IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION.  HE TOLD THE OFFICER THAT THE VICTIM WAS TRAVELING FAST AND HE STOPPED HIS M/V IN THE INTERSECTION TO ALLOW HER TO PASS WHEN THE VICTIM RODE INTO THE CURB, WHICH CAUSED HER TO FALL TO THE GROUND.  HE REPORTED THAT HIS M/V DID NOT STRIKE THE VICTIM'S BICYCLE AND HE SHOWED THE OFFICER HIS M/V, WHICH DID NOT APPEAR TO HAVE ANY DAMAGE RELATED TO STRIKING THE VICTIM'S BICYCLE.  THE OFFICER WAS ASSISTED AT THE SCENE BY P.O. xxxxxxxxxx. xxxxxxx (xxxxx).

Narrative:
About xxxxxx on Wednesday March xx, xxxx Officers xxxxxxxxx in the xxxxx received a radio call for a pedestrian struck at the corner of Ruggles and Tremont Street, Roxbury.

Upon arrival officer spoke with the operator if vehicle #x (xxxxxxx, xxxx) who stated that while xxxxxxxxxx inbound on Ruggles Street he struck a bicyclist. The operator stated that he was xxxxxxx in the set of lights at Tremont and Ruggles being green. The operator then stated that he struck the victim ( xxxxxx, xxxxxx) immediately following the set of lights at Tremont and xxxxxx Street.

While on scene officer spoke with two witnesses xxxxxxxxx, PETER (witness #x) and xxxxx, xxxxxxx xxxxxx (witness #x). Both witnesses stated that the light was red when the operator struck the victim. The officer later spoke with the victim at the hospital who stated he had a walk sign and began to cross the street with his bicycle. FULL_ADDRESS: 697 Commonwealth Ave Fenway , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx hours on xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx Officer K. xxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit was dispatched to a pedestrian struck on St. xxxx's Street at xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue.  On arrival, Brookline Fire was on scene treating the struck bicyclist on St. xxxx's Street.  Boston EMS, Ambulance xx and Paramedic xx also arrived on scene.  The operator of the vehicle involved was identified as xxxxxx K. WING xx.  The operator did not report any injuries and did not wish to be treated by EMS.  The operator stated he was taking a right hand turn onto St. xxxx's Street at a slow rate of speed when a bicyclist struck the front passenger side of his vehicle.  Operator stated he stopped his vehicle immediately and checked on the bicyclist who was down in the roadway.  Operator reported witnesses calling for help while he spoke with the bicyclist. The operator's vehicle, bearing MA REG: xxxxxx, sustained minor damage to the front, passenger side, wheel panel, where the bicyclist had struck the vehicle.  The operator's vehicle was insured by Commerce Insurance.  

The bicyclist was identified as xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.  Victim sustained moderate head injuries and was transported by Paramedic xx (xxxxxxxx and xxxxxx) to Brigham and Women's Hospital.  Victim remained alert and conscious at all times after the accident.  Officer spoke to numerous witnesses to the accident, all of whom, believed the vehicle operator did nothing wrong.  Witnesses stated the bicyclist was traveling extremely fast, weaving thought traffic and pedestrians, both on and off the sidewalk.  Witnesses also believed the bicyclist appeared to try and beat the vehicle to the turn and almost cut him off, until he collided with the vehicle.  The bicyclist was not wearing a helmet.  The bicycle was taken to xx and turned over to the property clerk.  There was no obvious damage to the bicycle at the time of this report.  

Brookline Police were called to the scene, as the accident occurred on the Brookline section of St. xxxx's Street.  Officer xxxxxx xxxxxxx declined jurisdiction stating the section of the street from the xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx to the parking meter was not Brookline.  A Brookline "No Parking from here to corner" sign however, does include the section of the street where the accident occurred.  xxxx was advised of the situation and advised xxxxx to take the report and note the exact location of the accident.

Upon arrival, the officer spoke with the victim (xxxxxx xxxxxx) who stated that she was riding her bicycle inbound on xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue when she was struck by a motor vehicle (MA reg. xxxxxx) as she crossed the intersection at Massachusetts Avenue.  xxxxxx reported that she was following behind a van as she crossed Mass Ave when she was struck on her right side by a motor vehicle xxxxxxxxx through the intersection on Mass Ave.  xxxxxx stated that she fell on her left side on the street, and the officer observed that she suffered scrapes on her left elbow.  xxxxxx also reported that her arm xxxxx a little, and requested medical assistance.  xxxxxx was evaluated and transported to Beth Israel Medical Center by Ambulance xxx (xxxxxxxxxxxxx).

The officer also spoke with the driver of the motor vehicle MA reg. xxxxxx (xxxx xxxxxxx) who reported that as he approached the intersection on Mass Ave, a van traveling inbound on Comm Ave ran the red light.  xxxxxxx stated that when he xxxxxxxx through the green traffic light, his view of the cyclist riding behind the aforementioned van was obstructed, causing him to accidentally strike the cyclist with his motor vehicle.  xxxxxxx reported he was traveling at about xx miles per hour.  The officer observed a cracked grill and scratches on the front bumper of xxxxxxx's car that were consistent with the color of the bicycle and the type of incident.  xxxxxxx refused all medical attention.

VICTIM # x TOLD THE OFFICER THAT SHE THOUGHT SHE WAS GOING TO BE ABLE TO TURN IN TIME, HOWEVER HER BICYCLE RODE INTO THE PASSENGER SIDE AREA OF M/V # x (MA REG # xxxxxx - xxxx xxxx xxxxx - PROGRESSIVE DIRECT xxxxx).  VICTIM # x COMPLAINED OF PAIN TO HER RIGHT LEG, xxxxxxxxx, AND OTHER MINOR ABRASIONS THAT SHE SUSTAINED AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION WITH THE M/V.  VICTIM # x WAS SUBSEQUENTLY TRANSPORTED TO CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL BY EMS AMBULANCE # xxxx (xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) FOR TREATMENT OF INJURIES THAT SHE SUSTAINED IN THE ACCIDENT. THE OFFICER ALSO SPOKE WITH THE OPERATOR OF M/V # x WHO EXPLAINED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING IN HER M/V ON xxxxxxx ST AND SHE WAS IN THE PROCESS OF MAKING A RIGHT TURN ONTO xxxxxxxx ST, WHEN SHE OBSERVED VICTIM # x RIDING HER BICYCLE DOWN THE HILL ON xxxxxxxx ST.  THE OPERATOR TOLD THE OFFICER THAT SHE STOPPED HER M/V IN ORDER TO ALLOW VICTIM # x TO PROCEED AND AFTER SHE STOPPED, VICTIM # x RODE HER BICYCLE INTO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF HER M/V. FULL_ADDRESS: 2582 Washington St Roxbury , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxx A.M. on Tuesday, May xx, xxxx, Officer xxxxxxx while assigned to the xxxxx unit, with the assistance of the area xxx Auto Investigator Officer xxxxx in the xxxx, responded to a radio call for a motor vehicle accident/pedestrian struck at St. xxxxx St and Washington St. xx.

Upon arrival, Officer observed Boston Ems (xxxx) on scene treating the victim (xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx. xxxxxxxx) in the rear of the ambulance.  Officer spoke with witness, xxxxxx xxxxxxx, while on scene.  Ms. xxx stated that while driving on Washington St she observed a black Honda accord with a Ma. registration xxxxxx operating in an xxxxxxx manner.  Ms. xxx stated that while she was traveling on Washington St towards the Dudley St area, the black Honda accord nearly struck her as it pulled out behind her from xxxxxxx xxxxxxx St.  Witness stated that the black Honda accord continued to operate in an xxxxxxx manner behind her as both vehicles traveled on Washington St.  Witness stated that she was xxxxxxxxxx the vehicle from her rear view mirror when she observed the vehicle strike the bicyclist in the area of xxxx Washington St. The victim (xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx) was traveling on Washington st towards the Dudley st area.  Ms. xxx stated that she witnessed the vehicle drive directly into Mr. xxx xxxxxxx and his bicycle, making no attempt to swerve away from the bicyclist.  Ms. xxx stated that she stopped her vehicle as soon as she saw the accident in order to offer some assistance.  Ms. xxx  stated that the vehicle came to a stop before speeding down Washington St towards the Dudley St area.  Ms. xxx stated she then followed the vehicle towards Dudley St and observed the vehicle take a left towards the Shawmut Ave area.  Ms. xxx stated she clearly observed a Ma reg  of xxxxxx on the black accord.

The victim ( xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx) was transported by Boston EMS (xxxx) for further treatment for head and neck trauma.  Officer observed the victim's Blue xxxxxxx bicycle have major damage to the rear wheel. The xxxx (xxxxxxx) responded and photographed the scene. The bicycle was brought to Area xxx, and logged in as evidence. 

Area xxx Auto investigator xxxxx queried the registration of the black Honda accord. The vehicle came back registered to a xxxxxx xxxxx of xxxx Tremont St.  Officer xxxxx proceeded to the registered owners address and spoke with the vehicle's owner.  The owner stated that she had not been driving the vehicle at the time of the accident and the vehicle had been in the possession of a xxxxxx xxxxxxx (xxxxxxx. xxxxxx).

Officer xxxxxxx proceeded to Boston Medical Center in order to speak with the victim. While on scene, the victim described the operator of the black Honda as a black male with a med build, in his late xx's, with xxxx xxxx, and a slight xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.  When asked if the victim could identify the suspect, Mr. xxx stated he could, without a xxxxx, identify the driver. Victim stated he got a clear look at the driver when the driver stopped the vehicle.  At this time, the victim's injuries do not appear to be life xxxxxxxxx.  Incident to be further investigated by the area xxx auto investigator.

Shortly after a description of the black accord was broadcast over channel x, the xxxx unit was able to locate the vehicle parked and unoccupied in the area of xx xxxxxxxx St. The xxxx(xxxxxxx) responded and photographed the vehicle.  A xxxxx of xx photos were taken of the vehicle and the crime scene.  With the permission of the xxxx (xxxxxx) Officer xxxxx towed the motor vehicle. Vehicle was towed by xxxxx's towing, tow line notified (xxxx). Claim check filed and form xxxx filled out. Nothing further at this time.

The xxxxx (xxxxxxxx) and the xxxxx (xxxxxxxxxxxxx) also responded on scene.

Officer xxxxxxx was speaking to xxxxxxxxxx while she was laying on the ground awaiting Boston EMS.  xxxxxxxxxx was complaining of pain to her right collarbone and shoulder.

FULL_ADDRESS: 1630 Washington St South End, Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx, Officer xxxxxxx in the xxxxx responded to a radio call for a pedestrian struck at Washington St. and W. Concord St.

   Upon my arrival, officer observed the victim alert and standing while being treated by members of the Boston fire department (xxx). A short time later, Boston EMS (xxxx - xxxxxxx, xxxxxx) arrived on-scene. Officer spoke to witnesses who stated that they observed the suspect vehicle (MA. Reg. xxxxxx) approach the crosswalk at W. Concord St. while traveling outbound on Washington St. The suspect vehicle approached the crosswalk at Washington St. and W. Concord St. and struck the victim as he was crossing the street. The witnesses stated that the victim (who was riding his bicycle) was in the crosswalk when he was struck by the suspect vehicle.

   Officer spoke to the victim who stated that he was riding his bicycle on W. Concord St. He stated that he approached the crosswalk on Washington St. and was attempting to cross the street while riding his bicycle when he was struck by the suspect vehicle (MA Reg. xxxxxx). The suspect vehicle was being operated by Mr. xxx xxxxxxxxxx (xxx xxxxxxxxx). 

   Officer spoke to Mr. xxx xxxxxxxxxx who stated that he was operating MA Reg. xxxxxx outbound on Washington St. When the suspect approached the crosswalk at W. Concord St and Washington St., the victim suddenly appeared from his right side and he struck the victim with the front bumper of MA Reg. xxxxxx. The suspect stated that he "didn't see him". The suspect immediately pulled over and waited for police and E.M.S.

   Boston E.M.S. (xxxx) transported the victim to Boston Medical Center for treatment. The victim complained of injuries to his left foot, back, right hip and right elbow. Officer did not observe damage to the victim's bicycle however, officer did observe blue and white scrape marks on the front bumper of the suspect vehicle. The blue and white paint was similar in color to that of the victim's bicycle. 

   As a result of witness statements as well as statements made by both Mr. xxx xxxxxx (victim) and Mr. xxx xxxxxxxxxx (suspect vehicle operator), officer issued Massachusetts Uniform Citation #xxxxxxxx (failure to yield to a pedestrian in a crosswalk) to Mr. xxx xxxxxxxxxx.

FULL_ADDRESS: 306 Huntington Ave Fenway , MA, USA

FULL_ADDRESS: 406 Blue Hill Ave Roxbury , MA, USA
Narrative:
On Wednesday, xxxxxxxxxx, at about xxxx hrs Officers xxxxxxx as the xxxxx  along with Superintendent xxxx as the xxxx responded to a radio call  for a hit and run motor vehicle  accident involving a bicyclist.  While en route to the scene the channel x dispatcher gave out a description of  the vehicle involved (MA REG xxxxxx / Caravan possibly Green in Color ) that fled the scene down xxxxx Street towards xxxxxxxx Rd.  Upon arrival scene was secured by the xxxx and H&H (Truck xx) was on scene treating the victim.

Officer xxxxxxx interviewed the Victim (xxxxxxx xxxxx) who reported that he had just left the xx hour store in Grove Hall with his friend and witness (xxxxxx Young) and they were traveling on their bicycles down Blue Hill Av inbound in the right hand lane. Blue Hill Av is a two way xxxxxx lane street divided by  double yellow lane xxxxxxx.  Victim went on to report that as he passed xxxxx St on his right hand side, a Mini Van (Green in Color and being driven by a light skinned male) made a left hand turn from the outbound lane of Blue Hill Av without signaling and struck him and his bicycle on the left side with the the vehicles front left corner.  Victim said the impact caused him to be thrown from his bicycle.  Victim reported having pain to the left side of his body.  Victim was subsequently transported to Boston Medical Center for further treatment and evaluation.

Officer xxxxxxx spoke to listed Witness x (xxxxxx Young) who reported that a Green Minivan with Massachusetts Plates of xxxxxx made a left hand turn from the outbound lane of Blue Hill Av to xxxxx Street and struck the victim on his bicycle on the left side with the vehicle's front left corner.  This xxxxxxxxxx  threw the Victim from his bicycle. Witness Young reported that a light skin male was driving the vehicle with a female front passenger and that the vehicle had tinted windows except for the front.

FULL_ADDRESS: 82 Southern Ave South Dorchester , MA, USA
Narrative:
On xxxxxxxxxx at xxxx hrs. Officers J. xxxxxxxx and Ace while assigned to the xxxxx Unit was on routine patrol in the area of xxxxxxxx Ave. and xxxxxx St. when they were flagged down.

Operator and owner, xxxxxxx  xxxxxx explained that she thinks she may have struck a child riding his bike with her vehicle.  xxxxxxx was not a hundred xxxxxxx that she actually made contact with the bike or the child just lost control because he thought he was going get hit.  xxxxxxx explained that she was operating Ma reg. xxxxxx, xxxx Toyota Camry on xxxxxxxx Ave in the area of #xx heading in the direction of New xxxxxxx Ave.  xxxxxxx explained that at the last second she noticed a little boy riding his bicycle come out from behind a parked vehicle and cross in front of her on xxxxxxxx Ave.  xxxxxxx believes she may have struck the little boy's bike with her drivers front corner bumper causing the bike to fall over and the boy to get thrown off the bike.  xxxxxxx explained that she was driving slow but was unable to avoid the boy because he came right out from behind the parked vehicle without looking.  Officers did observe xxxxxxx attempting to care for the boy upon pulling up to the area.  Officers did not observe any damage to the vehicle.  

Officers spoke with and identified the x year old boy as xxxxxx xxxxxxx.  Officers observed xxxxxx walking around and could not see any visual injuries.  xxxxxx was not complaining of any injures.  Officers notified dispatch, had a supervisor notified via dispatch and Boston EMS respond.  xxxxxx's father, xxxxxxx xxxxxxx (xx xxxxxxxx Av. #x) came outside, was updated and took custody.

The officer spoke with the operator of the truck (xxxxxxxx), who stated that he had taken a right turn from the right lane of Cambridge Street onto Blossom Street, when he was stopped by a number of taxi drivers xxxxxxxxx him that there was a bike stuck underneath his truck. Ms. xxx further stated that there was a green light and she was going straight when the truck turned right. Boston EMS xxx (xxxxxxx) provided medical attention to Ms. xxx, and informed the officer that she suffered no visible injuries as a result of the accident.  Ms. xxx complained of upper back and right shoulder pain.  Ms. xxx refused transport to the hospital for further evaluation.

At about  xxxx PM  xxxxxxxx, P.O xxxxxx xxxxxxx responded to xxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave, corner of xxxxxx Street, for a bicyclist hit.  Upon arrival, xxx and xxx were xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx Nelson (xxxxxxxx) who was standing on the corner, and was alert and xxxxxxxxxxxxx.  xxx (xxxxxx, xxxxxxxx) arrived and examined Miss Nelson, who declined medical attention.  She said she had minor discomfort on the right side of her right ankle, but was otherwise all right.  Officer observed minor swelling.

Operator xxxxxxx xxxxxx (xxxxxxxx) presented valid license and registration, and identified herself as the operator involved.  She said she was  on xxxxxx Street, and had come to a stop and was beginning to merge into traffic on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave (right turn only) when she was hit at the right-front corner of her motor vehicle by cyclist Nelson. FULL_ADDRESS: 410 Dudley St Roxbury , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx am Wednesday, xxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxxx assigned to the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a pedestrian hit by a motor vehicle at Dudley St and Blue Hill Ave.  Officers xxxx and xxxxxxx assigned to the xxxxx unit also responded to assist.  Officers xxxx and xxxxxxx arrived on scene and observed an Hispanic male laying in a xxxxx position not moving in the middle of Dudley St on the outbound lane.  In front of this male, was Massachusetts registration xxxxxx (xxxx black BMW xx).  This vehicle was facing Blue Hill Ave and positioned as to prevent other m/v's from traveling in the outbound lane in which the victim was laying in.  The victim, later identified as Victor xxxxxxxx, was being treated my members of the Boston Fire Department as well as Boston EMS xxxx.  Officer xxxx spoke with a black non-hispanic male who appeared to be very shaken.  He identified himself as xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx, the operator of the vehicle that struck the victim.  

     xxxxxxxxx stated that he was traveling on Magazine St and attempting to take a left turn onto Dudley St onto the outbound lane, when a bicycle came "out of no where" in front of him, causing him to lock his brakes.  xxxxxxxxx stated that he hit the victim with minimal force at which time the victim fell to the ground and did not move.  Officers on scene observed little to no damage to both the bicycle as well as xxxxxxxx'S motor vehicle.  Boston EMS (xxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) stated that the victim was talking, conscious and alert onscene.  He was transported to Boston Medical Center for further evaluation.  Officer xxxxxxx responded to the hospital to obtain the victims information as well as his status.  Dr xxxxxx xxxxxxx treated the victim and stated he had sore bruised legs.  Officers xxxx and xxxxxxx transported the victims bicycle (white colored mountain bike) back to District xx and secured it in the prisoner wagon bay.  No witnesses onscene.

FULL_ADDRESS: 76 Massachusetts Ave Back Bay , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx am on Thursday xxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a Pedestrian struck by a Motor vehicle at the intersection of Massachusetts Avenue and xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue.
Upon arrival, Boston Fire Engine #xx and Ladder #xx were already on scene tending to the victim, later identified as Ms. xxx xxxxxx.  Officer xxxxxxxx observed a xxxx Chrysler xxx with a shattered windshield and a small dent on the left front quarter panel, on the outbound side of Massachusetts Avenue.  On the street next to the front of the vehicle was the victim's xx speed style bicycle.

Officer xxxxxxxx spoke to the driver of the vehicle Mr. xxx xxxxx, who stated that he was traveling outbound on Massachusetts Avenue heading towards Cambridge.  Mr. xxx then stated that after the light turned green he proceeded to drive down Massachusetts Avenue, when the victim, Ms. xxx xxxxxx, drove her bicycle into the front left side of his vehicle.  Mr. xxx also stated that Ms. xxx was coming down xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue heading inbound from xxxxxxx Square.  Mr. xxx said that he had a green light and that she drove into him.

Officer xxxxxxxx spoke to a witness Ms. xxx xxxx who stated that she was traveling on Massachusetts Avenue heading inbound from Cambridge.  Ms. xxx then stated that she saw the light turn green and then saw the victim,Ms. xxx, on her bicycle coming from xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue crossing Massachusetts Avenue.  Ms. xxx said that she saw the first two vehicles stop for Ms. xxx, but that the vehicle coming the other way on Massachusetts Avenue did not see her.  Ms. xxx also stated that Ms. xxx was xxxxx she did not get hit by the other vehicles.  Officer then spoke to Mr. xxx xxxxx who was in the car with Ms. xxx.  Mr. xxx stated that when our light turned green he noticed Ms. xxx on her bicycle come through the intersection at Massachusetts Avenue and xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue.  Mr. xxx then stated that he saw the cars heading inbound on Massachusetts Avenue stop, and then Ms. xxx on her bicycle ride into the car traveling outbound.  

Officer xxxxxxxx then spoke to the victim Ms. xxx xxxxxx.  Ms. xxx stated that she was traveling inbound on xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue approaching Massachusetts Avenue when she observed the light turn yellow.  Ms. xxx then stated that she believed she had enough time to make it through the intersection.  Ms. xxx also stated that she could hear the car engine speeding up as she crossed the intersection, which was when she was struck.

Ms. xxx was treated on scene with a leg injury and then taken to Massachusetts General Hospital by Boston EMS, Ambulance xxx.  Boston Fire Engine #xx took Ms. xxx's bicycle to the fire station and informed her of their location on Harrison Avenue.

FULL_ADDRESS: 67 Water St Central Boston , MA, USA
Narrative: ON xxxxxxxx AT APPROXIMATELY xxxx HRS. THE xxxxx, OFFICER xxxxxxx RESPONDED TO CONGRESS xxxxxxxx ST FOR A REPORT OF A PEDESTRIAN STRUCK BY A BICYCLIST. UPON ARRIVAL OFFICER OBSERVED A LARGE CROWD GATHERED AROUND A FEMALE VICTIM LYING xxxxxx ON THE STREET BEING ATTENDED TO BY H & H xxx, EMT'S xxxxxxx AND xxxxxxxx. I SPOKE TO THE OPERATOR OF THE BICYCLE, (xxxxxxxxxxxxx) A MR. xxx OF ARLINGTON, MA xxx xxxxxxxx WHO STATED HE WAS TRAVELING ON WATER ST. TOWARDS CONGRESS ST. AND HAD THE GREEN LIGHT TO PROCEED AND WHILE SLOWING DOWN TO TURN RIGHT ONTO CONGRESS ST. HE BUMPED INTO THE VICTIM MR xxx. xxx CAUSING HER TO FALL TO THE GROUND. MR. xxx FURTHER STATES HE                             SAW THE GROUP OF PEDESTRIANS STANDING ON THE CURB AT THE CORNER OF xxxxxxxxxxxxxx ST AWAITING THE PEDESTRIAN LIGHT TO ALLOW THEM TO CROSS CONGRESS ST.  AS HE HAD THE GREEN LIGHT HE DID NOT SEE THAT MR xxx. xxx HAD STEPPED OFF THE CURB AND WAS CROSSING CONGRESS ST. AGAINST THE PEDESTRIAN DON'T WALK LIGHT. OFFICER xxxxxxx THEN SPOKE TO BOTH WITNESSES, MS. xxx xxxxxx & MR. xxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx WHO BOTH STATE THAT THE BICYCLIST, MR. xxx DID xxxxxx HAVE THE GREEN LIGHT TO PROCEED THROUGH THE INTERSECTION AND THAT MR xxx. xxx DID CROSS xxxxx AGAINST THE PEDESTRIAN SIGNAL. THE WITNESSES FURTHER STATE MR xxx. xxx HAD HER BACK TO THE CYCLIST AND THAT MR. xxx DID NOT SEE THE VICTIM AND HAD LITTLE TIME TO REACT AND THE IMPACT WAS LOW, KNOCKING MR xxx. xxx DOWN. I THEN WENT TO MASS GENERAL HOSPITAL TO SPEAK TO THE VICTIM MR xxx. xxx AND SHE STATED SHE DOES NOT REMEMBER THE INCIDENT BUT KNEW SHE WAS AT CONGRESS xxxxxxxx ST. SHE DOES NOT RECALL BEING STRUCK BY A BICYCLE. MR xxx. xxx WAS TREATED FOR FACIAL INJURIES, (ONE TOOTH KNOCKED OUT, TWO OTHERS LOOSE) AND A BLOODY NOSE BY DR. xxxxxx BROWN, NO OTHER COMPLAINTS OR INJURIES NOTED NOR MENTIONED. xxxxxxxxxxxxx BICYCLE IS A GIANT xxx LIMITED COLOR YELLOW & BLACK AND NO DAMAGE TO THE CYCLE NOR ANY INJURIES TO MR. xxx. THE xxxx, DETECTIVE xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx OF INCIDENT AND COPY OF REPORT GIVEN TO HIM. MASS CRASH REPORT ALSO COMPLETED.

Witness stated that the suspect kept driving and only stopped after him and other bystanders yelled at him. Officers observed that victim appeared to be visibly shaken and was holding his lower left leg. 

       Officers spoke with the victim who stated that he was standing on his friend's (xxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxx) bicycle on the crosswalk at Centre Street and xxxxx Street when the school bus making a right turn onto xxxxx Street stuck him causing him to fall. Officers observed the victim sitting on the sidewalk crying. Victim stated that everything happened so fast that he could not tell if the bus had ran him over or not. Officers observed that the victim to had a bruise on his lower left leg. Officers observed a blue BMX bicycle with the handlebar twisted out of place, on the floor right next to the victim.

       Boston EMS ambulance xxxx (xxxxxxx and xxxxxxxx) responded and transported the victim to the Children's Hospital. Victim's Aunt, xxxxx xxxxxxxx Colon (xxxxxxxxxxxx) of xx xxxxx Street Apt. x, accompanied the victim in the ambulance. 

       Officer's spoke with the suspect who stated that he was traveling inbound on Centre Street and before making the turn onto xxxxx Street, looked both ways and noticed that there were no pedestrians crossing the street. Suspect added that after he started to make the turn he heard a noise of something hitting the side of the bus. Suspect added that he looked at the mirror and observed that a child was lying on the ground right next to the bus. Suspect stated that he pulled over as soon as he could. 

       Officer xxxxxxxx spoke with witness#x (xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx) who stated that he saw the school bus's rear tire go on the sidewalk as the driver was making the turn. Witness stated that the victim was struck while he was sitting stationary on the bicycle. Witness stated that the victim was struck by the rear end on the bus.

FULL_ADDRESS: 1171 Tremont St Roxbury , MA, USA
Narrative:
ABOUT xxxxxxx ON FRIDAY, xxxxxxxx, OFFICER xxxxxxx WHILE IN THE xxxxx UNIT, WAS INVOLVED IN A DEPARTMENT MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT INVOLVING A BICYCLIST AT THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxxxx ST AND TREMONT ST, ROXBURY.

OFFICER xxxxxxx HAD BEEN RESPONDING TO THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxx ST AND ROXBURY STREET FOR A SEPARATE INCIDENT INVOLVING A BREAKING AND ENTERING TO A MOTOR VEHICLE. WHILE MAKING THE LEFT TURN ONTO TREMONT STREET FROM RUGGLES STREET, OFFICER xxxxxxx OBSERVED A BLACK MALE IN A WHITE COLORED SHIRT LOOKING INTO CAR WINDOWS ON xxxxxxxx ST. OFFICER xxxxxxx AT THIS POINT ACTIVATED HER BLUE LIGHTS AND HEADED TOWARD xxxxxxxx STREET TO INVESTIGATE GIVEN THE FACT THAT A BREAKING AND ENTERING TO A MOTOR VEHICLE HAD JUST TAKEN PLACE IN THE SAME AREA. AT THIS POINT A BICYCLIST (xxxxxxx, xxxx) CUT IN FRONT OF OFFICER xxxxxxx WHILE TRAVELING ON TREMONT ST. OFFICER xxxxxxx WAS GOING xxxx MILES PER HOUR AT THIS POINT, AND UPON SEEING THE BICYCLIST IN HER xxxxxxxxxx VISION, SLAMMED ON HER BREAKS.

THE RIGHT FRONT PART OF THE MARKED DEPARTMENT CRUISER, WITH BLUE LIGHTS ACTIVATED, CAME IN CONTACT WITH THE REAR WHEEL OF MR. xxx'S BICYCLE, CAUSING HIM TO FALL ON HIS RIGHT SIDE. OFFICER xxxxxxx IMMEDIATELY EXITED THE DEPARTMENT CRUISER AND REQUESTED EMS TO RESPOND, ALONG WITH THE PATROL SUPERVISOR (xxxx) AND AUTO INVESTIGATOR (xxxx, xxxxx). MR. xxx WAS FULLY CONSCIOUS AND STOOD UP. OFFICER xxxxxxx ADVISED HIM TO SIT ON THE CURB AND WAIT FOR EMS. UPON FIRE AND EMS ARRIVAL MR. xxx DECLINED MEDICAL ATTENTION.

PHOTOS WERE TAKEN BY THE CRIME SCENE RESPONSE UNIT, xxxx (xxx) AND xxxx (xxxxxx). NO DAMAGE WAS SUSTAINED TO THE DEPARTMENT VEHICLE. THE FRONT WHEEL OF MR. xxx'S BICYCLE HAD COME OFF OF THE BICYCLE. AFTER MR. xxx'S INFORMATION WAS TAKEN, MR. xxx EXPLAINED HE HAD TO GO TO WORK, AND SUBSEQUENTLY PICKED UP HIS BICYCLE AND CARRIED IT AWAY WITH HIM. OFFICERS ALONG WITH THE xxx PATROL SUPERVISOR, FOLLOWING MR. xxx LEAVING, CANVASSED DOWN xxxxxxxx FOR THE BLACK MALE LOOKING INTO CAR WINDOWS TO NO AVAIL.

I then spoke to the victim, operator of the xxxx black Audi, Ms. xxx who stated she was traveling on xxxxxx St, in the left lane stopping for the red light at Tremont St. When the light turned green she started to go and yielded for an unknown taxi which was on xxxxxx St. attempting to turn left across her lane of traffic onto Tremont St. The taxi then stopped and allowed the suspect the right of way and as she started to go she felt a bump and never saw the bicycle messenger attempting to turn left across her lane of travel. FULL_ADDRESS: 80 Newbury St Back Bay , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx p.m. on Wednesday July xx, xxxx, Officers xxxxxxx and xxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit, assisted by the xxxx (Sgt. xxxxxxxx), responded to a radio call for a fight near xx xxxxxxx Street.

On arrival, officers spoke with Mr. xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx who stated that he had struck the mirror of a xxxxxxxx Benz xxxxx (MA reg xxxxxx) while riding his bicycle.  Mr. xxx was riding in the company of Mr. xxx xxxxx (victim) at the time of the incident.  Mr. xxx admitted to officers that he was operating his bicycle in the opposite direction of traffic and was attempting to ride in between the xxxxxxxx Benz and other parked motor vehicles when he struck the mirror.  Mr. xxx stated that after he made contact with the vehicle he stopped his bike and was confronted by the operator of the vehicle (later identified as xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx).  Mr. xxx stated that he offered to go to a nearby xxx to xxxxxxxx one hundred dollars to give to Mr. xxx as payment for any damage he had caused.  

Mr. xxx stated that he was xxxxxxxxxx of Mr. xxx's actions and did not believe that he was going to return with the money.  Mr. xxx stated that when Mr. xxx left the area, his friend Mr. xxx remained on scene.  Mr. xxx stated that Mr. xxx suddenly got on his own bicycle and attempted to leave the area.  Mr. xxx stated that he grabbed the bike in an attempt to keep Mr. xxx on scene until Mr. xxx returned with the money.  

Mr. xxx stated to officers that he did attempt to leave the area since the incident did not directly concern him.  Mr. xxx stated that Mr. xxx grabbed him from behind on his right upper arm area and attempted to pull him off of the bike.  Mr. xxx stated that during the brief xxxxxxxx his black back pack was damaged.  Officers observed damage to the right shoulder xxxxx of the bag.  Mr. xxx then stated that Mr. xxx held onto his bicycle stating "You need to stay here, you need to stay here with me!"

Moments later as police were arriving onscene, Mr. xxx arrived back with one hundred dollars cash. 

Officers assisted the parties on scene exchange information.  Officers advised all parties on the proper xxxxx course of action to be taken going forward if they decided to pursue the matter.  No money was exchanged between any of the parties involved.

Narrative:

    UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICER xxxxxxx OBSERVED A xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx BEARING MASS REG xxxxxx AT THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxx ST AND xxxxx ST WITH ITS LIGHTS ON AND THE ENGINE IDLING.  OFFICER xxxxxxx FIRST SPOKE WITH THE xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx,  OF MASS REG xxxxxx WHOM STATED THE FOLLOWING.  THE SUSPECT STATED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING ALONG xxxxx ST(OUTBOUND TOWARDS xxxxxxxxxx ST) WHILE OBSERVING A CLEARLY MARKED STOP SIGN AND MADE A COMPLETE STOP BEFORE xxxxxxxxx FORWARD INTO THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxx ST AND xxxxx ST.  WHILE MOVING HIS VEHICLE FORWARD, A PEDESTRIAN RIDING A BICYCLE IN THE WRONG DIRECTION OF THE xxxxxx ST, WHICH IS A ONE WAY STREET, STRUCK THE VICTIM, xxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx INADVERTENTLY.  THE SUSPECT FURTHER STATED TO OFFICER xxxxxxx THAT AFTER HE REALIZED WHAT HAD HAPPENED HE IMMEDIATELY PUT HIS VEHICLE IN REVERSE CAUSING THE VICTIM'S BICYCLE TO GET STUCK UNDER THERE UNDER CARRIAGE OF HIS xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

     AFTER SPEAKING WITH THE SUSPECT, OFFICER xxxxxxx WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF OFFICER xxxxxxxxx IN THE xxxxx UNIT SPOKE WITH THE VICTIM WHOM WAS STANDING ON HIS FEET BUT WHO SEEMED TO BE DAZED.  AFTER SPEAKING WITH THE VICTIM, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT HE WAS TRAVELING UP xxxxxx ST IN THE WRONG DIRECTION AS REPORTED BY THE SUSPECT.  

     ALSO, OFFICER xxxxxxxxx SPOKE WITH THE WITNESS, xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx, WHOM STATED THAT WHILE STANDING IN FRONT OF xxx xxxxxx ST HE OBSERVED THE EVENTS AS THEY xxxxxxxx.  THE WITNESS STATED THAT THE SUSPECT FAILED TO MAKE A COMPLETE STOP AT THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxx ST AND xxxxx ST.  THE WITNESS FURTHER STATED THAT THE VICTIM WAS TRAVELING UP xxxxxx ST IN THE WRONG DIRECTION, CAUSING HIM TO BE STRUCK BY THE FRONT OF THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE AND BEING PUSHED OFF HIS BIKE LANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ABOVE MENTIONED INTERSECTION.

     AS A RESULT, AND UNDER THE xxxxxxxxxx OF THE xxxx (SGT. xxxxxxx) OFFICER xxxxxxx ISSUED THE OPERATOR/SUSPECT A MASS UNIFORM CITATION(xxxxxxxx) UNDER xxxxxxxxx FOR FAILURE TO MAKE A COMPLETE STOP AT THE CLEARLY MARKED STOP SIGN AT THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxx ST AND xxxxx.

     BOSTON EMS, AMB xxxx, ARRIVED ON-SCENE TO MEDICALLY EVALUATE THE VICTIM.  THE VICTIM COMPLAINED OF LEFT HIP PAIN AND RIGHT ELBOW PAIN BUT REFUSED TO BE TRANSPORTED TO MGH FOR A MORE EXTENSIVE MEDICAL EVALUATION.

    THE xxxx, DET xxxxxx,  ARRIVED ON SCENE TO TAKE PHOTOS OF THE INCIDENT.

FULL_ADDRESS: 76 Massachusetts Ave Back Bay , MA, USA
Narrative:
At approximately xxxxxx on Friday, August xx, xxxx - Officer S. xxxxxx in the xxxxx Unit responded to a radio call for a bicyclist that had been struck by a motor vehicle at the intersection of Massachusetts Avenue and xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue, Boston.

Upon arrival, Officer observed that the victim was walking and talking with Boston EMS Units.  Officer immediately contacted the xxxx (Sgt. xxxxxxx) and advised him about the nature of the incident as well as the extent of the victim's injuries (non life threatening). 

Officer first met with the victim (xxxxx, xxxxx xxxxxx), who stated that he had been riding his bicycle with the flow of traffic on Massachusetts Avenue headed towards Beacon Street.  Mr. xxx stated that he observed a yellow taxi (MA reg xxxxxxx) in the roadway waiting to take a left turn onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue.  According to Mr. xxx, the taxi had also stopped to allow several pedestrians to cross the street.  Mr. xxx stated that as he began crossing over xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue to continue on Massachusetts Avenue, the taxi took the left turn and collided with his bicycle.  Mr. xxx stated that he was thrown off of his bicycle and up into the air before he landed, making contact with the pavement on the left side of his upper body as he did so.  Officer observed a large abrasion on the inside of Mr. xxx's right thigh.  Mr. xxx also had scrapes and abrasions to his right knee, left xxxxxxxxxxxx, and a slight bump on the left side of his head.  Officer also observed that the bicycle helmet Mr. xxx was wearing during the collision had sustained xxxxxxxxxxx damage to the left rear area (xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx separated from outer part of the helmet).  Boston EMS Ambulance xxxx (xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) responded to the area and after treating some of Mr. xxx's injuries at the scene, transported him to the Beth Israel Deaconess Medical center for further treatment/evaluation.

Officer then spoke with the operator of the taxi (suspect xxxxxx, xxxxxxxx xxxxxx).  Mr. xxx stated that he was traveling in the left lane of Massachusetts Avenue and stopped to take a left-hand turn onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue.  Mr. xxx added that he had paused before xxxxxxxxxx the left turn while he waited for several pedestrians to cross the roadway.  Mr. xxx stated that as he began his turn onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue, a bicyclist traveling in the opposite direction collided with his taxi.  Mr. xxx stated that he observed Mr. xxx on his bicycle previous to xxxxxxxxxx the left-hand turn, and believed that he was going to stop.  After the collision, Mr xxx immediately parked his taxi and went over to Mr. xxx to evaluate the extent of his injuries.  

Officer spoke with the woman (witness #x - xxxxx, xxxxxxxx xxxxxx) who was seated in the rear of Mr. xxx's taxi during the collision.  Ms. xxx stated that she did not observe Mr. xxx on his bicycle previous to the collision.  According to Ms. xxx, once Mr. xxx made contact with the taxi, she observed him thrown high enough into the air such that he was xxxxxxxxxxxx and his body was parallel to the roadway.  Ms. xxx immediately contacted xxx in order that Boston EMS and Boston Police Units respond.

Officer then spoke with Ms. xxx xxxxxx (witness #x) and Ms. xxx xxxxxx (witness #x) who observed the incident as pedestrians in the roadway.  These witnesses stated that Mr. xxx had crossed over into about the middle of the intersection before Mr. xxx began his left turn.  

Officer observed the damage to Mr. xxx's bicycle (red xxxxxxx Record xxxxxxxxxxx).  The right xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx had sustained damage where it made contact with the taxi.  The bicycle frame and xxxxxxxxxx also sustained damage as a result of the collision.  Mr. xxx stated that his bicycle could be left at the scene while he was evaluated at the hospital, and was secured (with a bicycle lock) to the black xxxxxxx xxxx fence on Massachusetts Avenue.

Officer then went over to the taxi

Narrative:
At about xxxxx AM on Saturday, xxxxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a Motor Vehicle Accident - Pedestrian - Injuries at (xxxxxx Gas Station) xxx Chestnut Hill Avenue, Brighton.

Upon arrival, Officer xxxxxxxxx observed the Fire Department and Boston EMS treating the victim (bleeding from the back of the head), xxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx, at the address above.  Victim's body was laying down on the road near the sidewalk, head on the road on Chestnut Hill Road and his feet facing the sidewalk and xxxxxxxxxxxxx for the gas station - slightly in an angle.  Victim's xxxxxxxxx Schwinn BMX bicycle was laying next to him - between the victim and the operator's gray xxxx xxxx Explorer (xx Reg: xxxxxxx - xxxxx Insurance - Policy # xxxxxxxxx).  

Operator, Victor xxxxxxx, stated as he was exiting the gas station - with intentions to veer right onto Chestnut Hill Avenue towards xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue - he stopped momentarily over the sidewalk.  He claimed he recalls two vehicles passing by him until he was cleared to move forward.  Operator went onto state he looked quickly to the right before he xxxxxxxx forward.  At this point, the witness (xxxxx xxxxxxx) who was sitting on the front passenger side seat, yelled, "Don't move!" as they observed a xxxxxxx cut in front of the vehicle and then falling to the ground in front of the xxxx Explorer.  Operator and both witnesses made similar statements of the incident.

Boston Fire reported that the bicyclist (xxxxxxxxx) was unconscious when they arrived but regained xxxxxxxx shortly after they began treating him.  Boston Fire and EMS reported that Mr. xxx had sustained an injury to the back of his head.  Officer xxxxxxxxx Mr. xxx was unable to provide a statement from Mr. xxx because he was agitated and uncooperative at the time complaining of body xxxxx.  District xx Patrol Supervisor xxxx (Sgt. xxxxxx) was notified and responded to the scene.  Mr. xxx was then transported to Brigham & Women's Hospital by the xxxx (xxxxxxxxxxxx) for further evaluation.  Officer xxxxxxxxx was advised to obtain the victim's statement (if possible) at the hospital by the xxxx (Sgt. xxxxxx)

Officer xxxxxxxxx recovered and transported Mr. xxx's bicycle to xxxx for safekeeping, and then xxxxxxx the hospital in order to obtain a victim's statement.  Officer xxxxxxxxx spoke with nurse (xxx) and she stated he was stable and conscious and that he had sustained injuries to the back of the head and other xxxxxxxxxxxxxx around his body.  Victim was waiting to be seen by the doctors at that moment - no further information on victim's condition provided.  Officer xxxxxxxxx then spoke with victim who was alert in bed.

Mr. xxx mentioned he was riding his bicycle on the sidewalk going down on Chestnut Hill Avenue from xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue towards xxxxxxxxx Avenue.  Mr. xxx stated as he was riding down, he observed the xxxx Explorer in the process of exiting the xxxxxx Gas Station - and about to cross the sidewalk.  Mr. xxx stated there was a short distance between his bycicle and the moving vehicle.  When he realized he was going to collide with the moving vehicle, he tried to xxxxxxxx around the vehicle to avoid impact, but was unsuccessful.  Mr. xxx mentioned he felt an impact to his left leg which caused him to fall down and hit his head on the ground.  Officer xxxxxxxxx advised the victim and then contacted the operator and informed him of the victim's condition.  Operator mentioned over the phone that he recalls allowing three (x) pedestrians to cross on the sidewalk, and then he moved forward a little thus blocking the crosswalk while he observed traffic for xxxxxxxxx.

FULL_ADDRESS: 375 Huntington Ave Fenway , MA, USA
Narrative:
At approximately xxxxxx on Thursday, August xx, xxxx - Officer S. xxxxxx in the xxxxx Unit, along with the xxxx (Sgt. xxxxx) responded to a radio call for a bicyclist that had been struck by a motor vehicle at the intersection of xxxxxxx Street and Huntington Avenue, Boston.

Upon arrival, Officers immediately observed that the bicyclist was conscious, standing up, talking and walking around the scene.  Officer first spoke with the bicyclist (victim xxxxxxxx, xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx), who stated that she was traveling on xxxxxxx Street.  Ms. xxx stated that she waited for the traffic signal xxxxxxxxx the lanes of traffic on xxxxxxx Street to turn green, and then proceeded to ride her bicycle across Huntington Avenue (towards xxxxxxxx Street) and continue on xxxxxxx Street.  Ms. xxx stated that she observed a white sedan (later identified as MA reg xxxxxx - white Honda Accord) traveling in the opposite direction on xxxxxxx Street.  According to Ms. xxx, the Honda Accord was traveling slowly, but had not indicated that it would be taking a turn (by xxxxxxxxxx the turn signal indicator).  xxxxxxxxx that the Honda would continue straight on xxxxxxx Street and was traveling slowly as a result of the pedestrian and bicycle traffic in the roadway, Ms. xxx continued crossing the intersection.  At this point, the Honda began xxxxxxxxxx a left-hand turn onto Huntington Avenue, and collided with the front portion of Ms. xxx's bicycle, causing her to fall onto the pavement.  Ms. xxx's left elbow and right knee xxxxxxxx the xxxxxxxx of the impact when she fell to the ground.  Officer observed damage to the front tire (warped xxxxxxxxxxxxx), front fender (xxxxxxxxxxxx against tire), and front brake mechanism to Ms. xxx's bicycle.  xxxxxxx falling to the roadway, which caused her some xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx to her xxxxxxxxxx, Ms. xxx declined Boston EMS treatment/evaluation, stating that she would follow up with her primary care physician if the pain xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.

Officer then spoke with the operator (xxxxx, xxxxxx xxxxxxx) of the Honda Accord (MA reg xxxxxx).  Mr. xxx stated that he was traveling on xxxxxxx Street (headed away from xxxxxxxx Street) in the left lane of traffic.  Mr. xxx stated that he waited for the traffic signal xxxxxxxxx traffic on xxxxxxx Street to turn green, and proceeded to begin crossing through the intersection.  Mr. xxx did not recall xxxxxxxxxx his left turn indicator, and stated that he did not see Ms. xxx coming towards him in the roadway as he initiated a left-hand turn onto Huntington Avenue.  Mr. xxx stated that the vehicle's passenger side front bumper made contact with the front end of Ms. xxx's bicycle causing her to fall into the roadway.  Mr. xxx stated that he was traveling about fifteen (xx) miles per hour as he began making his turn onto Huntington Avenue.  Mr. xxx stated that he immediately parked the vehicle and exited to evaluate the extent of Ms. xxx's injuries, and the damage to the xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx (which is owned by a third party).  Mr. xxx was cooperative with Officers at the scene, and was very xxxxxxxxxx to Ms. xxx relative to the collision.  Officer observed an amount of light green paint (consistent with the bicycle paint job) and several scratches to the passenger side front bumper area of the Honda Accord where the impact occurred.

FULL_ADDRESS: MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxxxx, on Monday, xxxxxxxxx x, xxxx, Officer xxxxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a motor vehicle accident on xxxxxxx St. between the Boston Common and Boston Public Garden in Boston.

On arrival, Officer was met by Boston Fire and EMT personnel who stated that all parties refused medical attention on-scene.  Officer observed a parked Boston Fire vehicle parked near the accident scene in the left hand travel lane.  Officer requested identification from the parties involved.  Officer was provided a Massachusetts license and registration for the operator of a red xxxx Jeep Grand Cherokee (MA #xxxxxx, VIN #xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).  This license identified the operator as xxxxxxx xxxxxx (xxxxxxxx).  Both of these Registry documents were ACTIVE.

Officer was not able to get identification from the other party involved who was a bicyclist.  This bicyclist verbally identified himself to the Officer as xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx (xxxxxx).  Officer xxxxxxxx this information through his marked cruiser's MDT.

Officer asked Operator xxxxxx what had happened.  Operator xxxxxx stated to the Officer that he was traveling in the second left hand lane when he was passing a parked Boston Fire vehicle, which was parked in the left hand lane.  Operator stated that once he passed this parked vehicle he attempted to change lanes into the left lane when he heard an impact.  Operator believed he might have clipped this parked vehicle's front right fender, however, this impact was from a bicyclist who was traveling in the extreme right portion of the left lane.

Bicyclist xxxxxxx stated that he was traveling in the left hand lane when he was approaching a parked Boston Fire vehicle which was in the left lane.  Bicyclist xxxxxxx indicated that he began moving towards the extreme right portion of this left lane to go around this parked vehicle.  Bicyclist stated that he was struck by Operator xxxxxx who was changing lanes.

Officer observed front quarter panel damage (scuff xxxxxxxxxxx) to Operator xxxxxx's vehicle (MA #xxxxxx).  Bicyclist xxxxxxx indicated that his handlebars were bent.

Officer cited Operator xxxxxx for a violation of Massachusetts General Laws xxxx (Unsafe xxxxxxxxxx of a bicyclist) and cited him with a Massachusetts Uniform Citation (xxxxxxxx).  Officer mailed this to Operator xxxxxx.

Officer, further, cited the bicyclist (xxxxxxx) for a violation of Massachusetts General Laws xxxxx(failure to stay right) and cited him with a Massachusetts Uniform Citation (xxxxxxxx).  Officer mailed this citation Bicyclist xxxxxxx.

Officer completed Motor Vehicle Crash Report xxxxxx.

FULL_ADDRESS: 490 Massachusetts Ave South End, Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
At about xxxx AM on Monday xxxxxxxxx xx, xxxx Officer xxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a MVA involving a pedestrian in front of xxx Mass Av. Officer xxxx xxxxxxx, ID #xxxx was performing a paid detail for xxxx Construction in front of xxx Mass Av. when the MVA occurred. On arrival officer observed Boston EMS xxxx was attending to the victim, xxxx, xxxxxxx (W/M, xxx xxxxxxxxxx) who had suffered moderate, non-life threatening injuries to his face, and both hands. The victim's bicycle was lying in the right hand lane of Mass Av. The MV involved, xx reg. xxxxx, xxxx Hyundai sedan, color xxxx,  was parked in the right travel lane of Mass Av. Mass Av. is a xxxxxxx divided roadway. It is currently under construction with the right outbound lane being used for equipment from xxx to xxx Mass Av. There are orange traffic xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx the lane as being shut down to vehicular travel. 

Officer xxxxxxx stated that the bicycle was travelling outbound on Mass Av. to the left of stopped traffic, weaved around a stopped vehicle in traffic, across the travel lane and into the xxxxx off construction area where he passed the officer. This area is designated for no travel for vehicles. The traffic had just begun to move after being stopped for a red traffic light at the intersection of Tremont St. After passing the officer the bicyclist collided with the passenger side front door, mirror, and quarter panel. 

The victim stated that he was travelling in the right travel lane when a MV turned with no warning or signal device into his lane causing him to collide. The victim was asked whether he was in the travel lane, or to the right side of the traffic xxxxx? (Construction Area) xxxx stated he was in a travel lane. 

The operator of the MV, xxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxxx, N (W/M, xxx xxxxxxxxxx) stated he was stopped for the red light at Tremont St. The traffic light turned green and cars began to move. xxx his car was passed the construction zone he put is right blinker on and began to move to the right lane when the collision occurred. xxxxxxxxx stated he did not see the bicycle in the travel lane. 

Based on the location of the front passenger tire skid mark and the location of the final rest of the bike and victim the collision occurred on the lane xxxxxx between the left travel and right travel lanes.

FULL_ADDRESS: 55 Robert St Roslindale , MA, USA

About xxxxxx on Friday, xxxxxxxx officer xxxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a Pedestrian Struck at xx xxxxxx Street in xxxxxxxxxx.

On arrival the officer observed a white male on the sidewalk at the intersection of xxxxxx Street and S. xxxxxx Street being treated by members of BFD xxxxxxx.  The individual was identified as the victim, xxxxxxx xxxxx(xxxxxxxx).  Mr. xxx declined medical attention, but did have complaints of pain in his arm, hip and leg area that had made contact with the pavement after he had been struck.  The officer observed that Mr. xxx's bicycle, a xxxxxxxxx Fuji "xxxxxxx," was in the bed of the a Dodge Ram pick up truck bearing MA Reg# xxxxxx.  Mr. xxx stated that was the vehicle that had struck him.  Mr. xxx stated to the officer that he was traveling on xxxxxx Street from xxxxxxxx Avenue towards South Street.  Mr. xxx stated that he was on his bicycle at the time.  Mr. xxx stated that as he approached the intersection of xxxxxx Street and S. xxxxxx Street he observed the Dodge truck stop at the stop sign.  Mr. xxx stated that he had assumed the operator of the truck had seen him and he continued riding his bicycle on xxxxxx Street.  Mr. xxx stated that the truck then began to pull out onto xxxxxx Street.  Mr. xxx stated that the truck then made contact with him and he fell to the ground.  

The officer then spoke with xxxxx xxxxxx III(xxxxxxxx), who was the owner/operator of the Dodge Ram pick up bearing MA Reg# xxxxxx.  Mr. xxx stated that he was traveling on S. xxxxxx Street from xxxxxx Street towards xxxxxx Street.  Mr. xxx stated that he had stopped at the stop sign at the intersection of S. xxxxxx Street and xxxxxx Street in preparation to make a left turn onto xxxxxx Street.  Mr. xxx stated that he looked and did not see anyone, at which time he began to pull out onto xxxxxx Street.  Mr. xxx stated that was when he made contact with Mr. xxx.   

The following units responded to assist: xxxx(Sgt. xxxxxx), xxxx(xxxxxxx) and the xxxx(xxxxxxxxx).  Incident to be further investigated by the Area xx Auto Investigator.

FULL_ADDRESS: 655 Commonwealth Ave Fenway , MA, USA
Narrative:
On October x, xxxx at about xxxxx Officer V. xxxxx assigned to the xxxxx responded to the intersection of xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue and xxxxxx Street on a motor vehicle accident involving a pedestrian.

Upon arrival Officer xxxxx was advised that the victim was transported to Beth Israel Hospital Emergency Room and the suspect motor vehicle had left the scene without identifying himself to the victim of the accident.

Officer xxxxx observed left at the scene a brown mountain type bicycle which sustained extensive damages possibly from a motor vehicle accident.

Officer xxxxx subsequently responded to the Beth Israel Deaconess Hospital Emergency room and spoke with the victim that was involved in the accident.

The victim was identified as Ms. xxx xxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxx, xx xxxxxxx Street, xxxxxxx, Ma. xxxxx. Officer xxxxx subsequently asked Ms. xxx to describe what happened.

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that she was riding her bicycle on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave towards the Boston University Bridge. 

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that she was traveling with the flow of traffic on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave and the traffic light was a solid green.

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that as she approached the intersection of xxxxxxxxxxxx ave and xxxxxx Street, a brown Chrysler PT Cruiser was attempting to make a right turn onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave when she was struck by the front of the vehicle.

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that the vehicle attempted to merge into the flow of traffic and didn't come to a complete stop prior to doing so.

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that after she was struck and fell off her bicycle the vehicle dragged her bicycle approximately xxxxx feet.

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that the operator was advised to stop by an ambulance that happened to be traveling on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave.

Ms. xxx advised Officer xxxxx that while the EMT's were treating her for her injuries the operator pulled over to the right and subsequently left the scene without identifying himself or his motor vehicle's information.

Ms. xxx provided Officer xxxxx with a piece of paper that contained the license plate of the vehicle that struck her. 

The vehicle's registration was identified as Massachusetts registration xxxxxxx, xxxx Chrysler PT Cruiser color brown. Ms. xxx described the driver of the vehicle as an elderly white male and he seemed very confused.

A subsequent RMV check revealed the vehicle as being registered to Mr. xxx xxxxxxx, xxxxxxxx, xx xxxxxxxxxx Road, xxxxxxx, Ma. xxxxx.

A subsequent radio broadcast was done with the vehicle's description to the xxxxxxx and Mass. State police. 

An area check was done for the vehicle with negative results.

Officer xxxxx subsequently attempted to contact the registered owner via phone with negative results.

Officer xxxxx issued and mailed RMV citation # xxxxxxxx to Mr. xxx xxxxxxxx him with xxxxxxxxx Mass General Laws Chapter xx Section xx xxxxxxxxx leaving the scene of a motor vehicle accident after causing personal injury.

Mr. xxx will be summonsed into Boston Municipal Court for an hearing on the above charge.

Ms. xxx was transported to Beth Israel Hospital by EMS Ambulance xxx for pain and abrasions to her left and right arm and left leg.

Ms. xxx was treated by Dr. xxxxxx at the hospital for non life threatening injuries.

A copy of the xxxx and RMV Crash report was completed and placed into the Area xx Auto Investigators mail box.

FULL_ADDRESS: 400 Centre St Jamaica Plain , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxx am on Wednesday, October x, xxxx, Officer xxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a Motor Vehicle Accident involving a Bicyclist at xxx Centre Street (xxxx Square).

Upon arrival, Officer observed a motor vehicle (MA Reg #xxxxxx, xxxx Gray Honda Odyssey) at the intersection of Centre Street and xxxxxxx Street. Officer also observed a black bicycle laying in the street in front of the vehicle. Officer spoke with the victim (xxxxx Bars) who stated she was riding her bicycle down Centre Street when she attempted to go around the rotary to continue on Centre Street when she stated she was struck by the suspect vehicle. The victim stated that the suspect vehicle coming from Centre Street and was continuing straight down xxxxxxx Street. Officer observed there to be damage to the left side of the bicycle and left pedal. Officer also observed damage to the right hand bumper of the Honda Odyssey. Officer spoke with Witness #x (xxxxx xxxxxxx) who stated that he was standing outside of xxx Centre Street when he saw the victim (Bars) riding her bicycle down Centre Street and turned at the rotary to continue on Centre Street. Witness #x (xxxxxxx) stated that he did not see the accident occur, however, did state that the victim was ahead of the vehicle on Centre Street before taking the turn. Witness #x (xxxxxxx) stated that he observed the driver of the vehicle (xxxxx xxxxxxx) yelling at the victim after the accident occurred.

Officer spoke with the driver of the vehicle (xxxxx xxxxxxx) who stated she was driving down Centre Street when the victim (Bars) came off of Day Street and went straight on Centre Street. The driver stated that she did not see the victim and that the victim rode into her bumper. Officer also spoke to a witness #x (xxxxx xxxxxx) who was also in the vehicle who stated that the bicyclist came from Day Street and the bicyclist hit their vehicle at the intersection of Centre xxxxxxxxxx Street. 

Boston Fire Department (Ladder xx) and Boston EMS Ambulance xxx (xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx) responded on scene. Victim was treated by EMS for right elbow pain as well as head trauma from hitting her head on the pavement. Victim refused further treatment and declined EMS and Officers xxxxxxxx to be transported to the hospital. xxxx (Sgt. xxxxxx) responded to scene. xxxx (xxxxxx) notified of accident.

On arrival, officer observed a white motor vehicle MA registration xxxxxx, stopped in lane # x on xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue outbound.  The xxxx, xxxxx, and xxxxx  (Sgt. xxxxx, Officers xxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxx, and xxxxxx) responded as well and assisted with traffic control.

Officer xxxxxxxxx observed a female lying in the xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue roadway with Boston Fire personnel attending to her.  Officer met with the operator of the white motor vehicle, xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx, and asked him what happened.  xxxxxxxx stated that he was traveling on xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue outbound with the green light and suddenly was struck by an unknown bicyclist at the intersection with Harvard Avenue.  Officer observed moderate damage to xxxxxxxx's driver's side fender and the side view mirror was also broken.

Officer met with witness, Code Enforcement Officer xxxx xxxxxxx, and asked him what happened.  xxxxxxx stated he observed the bicyclist crossing xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue from the direction of Harvard Avenue.  xxxxxxx stated that he believed that the bicyclist rode into xxxxxxxx's vehicle.

Boston EMS xxxx (EMT's xxxxxxxxxxxxx and xxxxxx) arrived on-scene and transported the bicyclist, later identified as xxxxx Grant, to St. xxxxxxxxx's Medical center for further evaluation after complaining of right ankle injury, left xxxxxxxxxxxx, and right thigh injury.

Officer met with Grant and asked her what happened and she stated that she was coming from Harvard Avenue and attempting to cross and take a left onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Avenue.  Grant stated, "It's my fault, I didn't see the white car."

Based on the witness, bicyclist statement, and damage to motor vehicle, it appeared that the motor vehicle was not at fault.  Officer completed MA crash form xxxxxx.  It should be noted that Grant's bicycle was transported by BFD xxxxxxxxxx to the Union Square fire station.

Narrative:
About xxxxx am on xxxxxx xxxxxxxx Officer xxxxx in the xxxxx unit assisted by Officer xxxxx and xxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a pedestrian struck at the intersection of Blue Hill Ave and xxxxxxxx St.

On arrival Officer observed the victim, xxxxx xxxxx, lying in the ground partially on the sidewalk on xxxxxxxx St with a red mountain bike in the middle of xxxxxxxx St.  Officer spoke to the operator of the xxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx, who stated that he was traveling on Blue Hill Ave outbound and turned right on to xxxxxxxx St.  Mr xxx stated that as he turned on xxxxxxxx St, he observed the victim sitting on his bicycle talking to some people standing on the sidewalk on xxxxxxxx St (between xxxxxxx. & xx xxxxxxxx St).  Mr xxx stated that as he started traveling on xxxxxxxx St towards Warren St,  the boy on the bicycle without looking, pulled out into the middle of  xxxxxxxx St and directly in front of his vehicle.  Mr xxx stated he quickly slammed on the brakes, attempting to avoid a collision, but by the time the vehicle completely stopped, the boy was already "on" his car.  

Mr xxx stated  after the collision, the boy who never fell to the ground and just stepped off his bicycle and walked over to the side of the road where he laid down.  Mr xxx exited his vehicle and observed the bicycle tire slightly under his vehicle.  Mr xxx stated he backed his vehicle up and pulled to the side of the road without disturbing the bicycle.  Mr xxx called xxxxx and waited for the police to respond.

Boston EMS responded and xx transported Mr xxx, who appeared to be suffering from non-life threatening injuries, to BMC pediatrics for further treatment .

Narrative:
About xxxx hours on Monday, xxxxxxxx, Officer Vest in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call at xx xxxxxxxxx St., Dorchester.  On arrival, the officer spoke with xxxxx xxxxx who informed him that she had been driving her vehicle (xx Reg. xxxxxx) along xxxxxxxxx St. when she struck two children that were riding a bicycle across the street.  The Patrol Supervisor, Sergeant xxxxxxx (xxxx), responded to the scene.

Officer Vest then located the victims, xxxxx xxxxxxxx and xxxxxx xxxxxxxx, in the front hallway at xx xxxxxxxxx St. with their mother, xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx.  xxxxx xxxxxxxx stated that she and her sister had been on the bike riding toward home and that she tried to brake but that the brake on the bike didn't work.  xxxxx xxxxxxxx had a scrape to her left knee and xxxxxx xxxxxxxx had a scrape to her lower left leg, a scrape on her left ear, and she stated that her left foot hurt.  Boston Fire and EMS arrived and EMS treated both victims' injuries.  Mr xxx. xxx declined transportation to the hospital for her xxxxxxxxx and stated that she would transport them herself.  The officer inspected the victim's bicycle and both brakes appeared to be operating properly and the bicycle appeared to have no damage.

The officer then spoke again with xxxxx xxxxx.  Ms. xxx stated that she did not see the children until they were directly in front of her car.  She stated that she braked immediately but that her car continued forward slightly and struck the children.  The officer observed that the sun was xxxxxxx at that time causing glare directly down xxxxxxxxx St. for traffic traveling on the street.  The officer also observed a small scratch to the left side of the hood of the suspect vehicle and marks on the hood and left fender where the xxxx had been recently xxxxxxxxx.  The officer then spoke with xxxxxxx xxxxx who stated that she was the passenger in xxxxx xxxxx's car and that she also did not see the victims until they were directly in front of the car.  xxxxxxx xxxxx also stated that she believed that the victims had come out of the driveway at xx xxxxxxxxx St.  Officer Vest advised xxxxx xxxxx to complete a Massachusetts Motor Vehicle Crash Report.

FULL_ADDRESS: 280 Endicott St Central Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxx hrs on Thursday, xxxxxxxxxx, Officers xxxxx and xxxxx in the xxxxx unit observed an accident that involved a motor vehicle and a pedestrian at N. Washington St. and Causeway St., Boston.

Officers were on Causeway St at a red light and were waiting to turn left onto N. Washington St., when they observed the accident. Officer xxxxx observed the victim on N. Washington St and begin to walk into the intersection while all the other vehicles on N. Washington St. were stopped for a red light. Victim was in the intersection along with couple of other pedestrians. Victim took several steps into the intersection before he was hit by the vehicle (MA Reg xxxxxx). Operator (xxx, xxxx) was traveling in the middle lane and traveling southbound on N. Washington St.
Officer xxxxx observed the operator not stop for the red light and traveling at approximately xxxxx mph. Officer xxxxx observed the vehicle strike the victim's bicycle first and then strike the victim's left hand side of the body which caused the victim to fall down. At this time, the vehicle's tires did screech and the vehicle stopped couple of feet after the crosswalk. Both victim and the operator (xxx) of the vehicle were visibly shaken. When speaking to the operator (xxx) he stated that he did not speak English but was able to state several times that he was "ok". Officers did not observe any damage to his vehicle.
At this time, Officers requested for EMS and Ambulance xxxx (xxxxx & xxxx), xxxx (xxxxx & xxxxxxx) responded to the scene along with the Fire Dept. xxx (xxxxxxx, xxxxxxx, xxxxxx, xxxxxxx), xxx (xxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxx, xxxx, xxxxxxx) xxx (xxxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxx). Operator (xxx) declined any medical attention and was released from the scene. He was mailed a Mass Uniform Citation #xxxxxxxx for: (xxx:xx) Failure to Stop for a Red Light, (xxx:xxx) Failure to Stop for Pedestrians in a Crosswalk. xxxxxx xxxxxxx completed. Officers observed that the victim had bruises and scrapes on his left elbow and arm. He also complained of pain in his left of his body. He was evaluated on scene and was then transported to Mass. General Hospital for further evaluation. Officers also spoke to a witness (xxxxx, xxxxxxx) who was in the crosswalk with the victim. He stated that he was waiting with the victim for a "walk signal". He stated that vehicles stopped for the red light and they had the walk signal to cross the street. He stated that the victim was the first one in the crosswalk. He stated that he also observed the operator not stop for the light and strike the victim as he was in the crosswalk. He stated that he was not hit. EMS transported the bicycle with the victim. (xxxx) Sgt. xxxxx notified of the incident.

About xxxx p.m. on Monday October xx, xxxx, Officers xxxxxxx and xxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a bicyclist struck in the area of Massachusetts Avenue and xxxxxxxx Avenue.

On arrival, officers spoke with the victim (xxxxxx xxxx) who stated that he had been struck by a blue suv while riding on Massachusetts Avenue.  The victim stated that he was riding inbound on Massachusetts Avenue when he came in contact with the blue suv at Huntington Avenue.  The victim (xxxx) stated that he had the green light and that the suv turned right on red from Huntington Avenue onto Massachusetts Avenue inbound.  The victim stated that the vehicle came out too quickly for him to stop in time to prevent the contact.  The victim stated he struck the middle of the drivers side of the vehicle.  The victim stated that the vehicle did not stop after the collision and drove inbound on Massachusetts Avenue stopping at the set of lights at xxxxxxxx Road.  The victim stated that he caught up to the suspect vehicle at which time the driver began swearing at him, calling him a "Fucking xxxxx."  The victim stated that the suspect vehicle then turned left onto xxxxxxxx Avenue.  The victim (xxxx) stated that when the suspect observed that the victim was still following him on his bicycle, he stopped his vehicle abruptly, got out and attempted to push him.  The victim stated that the suspect continued to be verbally xxxxxxx to him during the xxxxxxxxxxxxx.  (The victim described the suspect as a white non-Hispanic male, in his forties, xxxxxxx height, heavy build, with dark hair which appeared to be xxxxxxxx on top.)  At this time, the victim made a note of the suspect's license plate and stated to him that he was calling the police. The victim stated that the suspect vehicle then fled on xxxxxxxx Avenue towards the Fenway.  Officers searched the area to no avail.  

The victim stated to officers that the suspect vehicle registration was xxxxxx.  Officers ran the plate which came back to a xxxx Jeep Cherokee, color blue, registered to Mr. xxx xxxxx (xxxxxxxx).

This incident to be further investigated by the District Four auto investigator.

FULL_ADDRESS: 252 Riverway Fenway , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxx AM on xxxxxx, xxxxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a pedestrian struck at Longwood Ave and The Riverway in the Longwood Medical Area.

On arrival, Officer xxxxxxx observed Boston EMS Ambulance xxxx on scene attending to a male bicyclist later identified as xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.  Officer xxxxxxx observed a taxi stopped with its hazard lights flashing, the taxi driver and another male on the side walk.  Officer xxxxxxx separated the individuals and interviewed them xxxxxxxxxxxxx.  

xxxx xxxxxxx stated that he was the front seat passenger of the taxi and really wasn't paying attention but looked up when he heard the impact.  

The taxi driver was identified as xxxxx xxxx (BPD Hackney Operator # xxxx).  xxxx stated that he was traveling outbound on the Riverway and turned right onto Longwood Avenue heading into Brookline.  xxxx stated that all of a sudden, xxxxxxxx was riding his bicycle against the flow of traffic with no lights and ran right into the front of the taxi.

Officer xxxxxxx spoke to xxxxxxxx who stated that he was riding home from working in Brookline.  Officer xxxxxxx asked xxxxxxxx which side of the road he was riding on.  xxxxxxxx stated that he crossed over to the left side as he approached the corner.  xxxxxxxx stated that he observed the taxi turning from the Riverway and yelled to the operator but it was too late.  

xxxx transported xxxxxxxx to the Brigham and Women's Hospital for further evaluation/treatment of his injuries.  xxxxxxxx complained of general back pain, right shoulder pain, left hand pain, right ankle pain and stated that his "teeth feel xxxxx" (although all teeth appeared intact according to EMTs.)

It should be noted that the portion of Longwood Avenue between the City of Boston and the Town of Brookline is xxxxxx lit, xxxxxxxx was riding against traffic in dark clothing, and xxxxxxxx's bicycle was not equipped with a headlight.  The bicycle did; however, have a small white reflector affixed to the front.  MGL xxx xxxx (x) states "During the period from xxxxxxxx hour after xxxxxx to xxxxxxxx hour before xxxxxxx, the operator xxxxx xxxxxxx to the front of his bicycle a xxxx xxxxxxxx a white light visible from a distance of at least five hundred feet, and to the rear of said bicycle either a xxxx xxxxxxxx a red light, or a red reflector visible for not less than xxx hundred feet when directly in front of xxxxxx lower xxxxx of xxxxxxxxx on a motor vehicle. A xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx which xxxxx light only when the bicycle is moving xxxxx meet the xxxxxxxxxxxx of this xxxxxx."  City of Boston City Ordinance Violation Notice # BPD xxxxxx issued as a written warning and mailed to xxxxxxxx for said chapter and section.

RMV Crash Form xxxxxx completed and filed.

xxxx was provided the CC# to this report, advised to complete an operator's crash form within five (x) business days and advised to contact his insurance company.  The taxi xxxx was operating is insured by Pilgrim.

xxxxxxxx's bicycle was secured at xxx.
