About xxxxx on xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx Officer xxxxx who was assigned in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for " Motor Vehicle/ Pedestrian Accident " at the intersection of Brighton Ave and Harvard Street, Brighton.

On arrival the Officer spoke with the victim {xxxxxxxxxxx} who stated that while he was riding his bicycle down Brighton Ave towards Harvard Ave the rear passenger door open up unexpectedly which caused him to strike the door.

The victim stated that when he hit the door he was slammed to the ground which caused damage to his left handle bar and left shifter and also damaged the seat of the bike.

The victim also stated that he had minor pain to his left shoulder and right knee.  The victim declined medical attention at the scene.

The owner and operator of the motor vehicle{Mass xxxxxx} stated that she was stopped at the red light and her father opened the rear passenger door to exit the motor vehicle and he  didn't see the bike rider.

The motor vehicle had damage to the passenger side rear door.

The Officer advised her to notify her drivers insurance of the incident.

FULL_ADDRESS: 634 Hyde Park Ave Roslindale , MA, USA
Narrative:
ABOUT xxxxxx, THURSDAY, JANUARY x, xxxx, OFFICER xxxxxx IN THE xxxxx RESPONDED TO A RADIO CALL FOR A xxxxxxxxxxxx ACCIDENT, WITH A PEDESTRIAN (CHILD) STRUCK ON xxxxxxxxxx STREET, AT xxxx PARK AVENUE, IN xxxxxxxxxx.  

ON ARRIVAL, OFFICER xxxxxx SPOKE WITH THE PEDESTRIAN, xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx, WHO STATED THAT HE WAS RIDING HIS RED MOUNTAIN BIKE, WHEN HE WAS HIT BY A SLOW MOVING PICKUP TRUCK.  xxxx STATED THAT HE WAS NOT HURT, BUT HE FELL OFF OF HIS BICYCLE, AND HIS JACKET WAS RIPPED.  xxxx STATED THAT THE WHITE MALE OPERATOR OF THE TRUCK STOPPED TO SEE IF HE WAS OKAY.  xxxx TOLD THE MAN THAT HE WAS FINE, AND THE MAN LEFT.  xxxx WAS CONCERNED THAT IF HIS FATHER FOUND OUT HE WAS INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT, HE MAY NOT ALLOW HIM TO RIDE HIS BIKE OUTSIDE AGAIN.  xxxx DID NOT WANT A BIG DEAL MADE OF THE INCIDENT, HE JUST WANTED TO CONTINUE ON HIS WAY.  xxxx WAS ADVISED THAT ALL PUBLIC xxxxxxxxx MUST FOLLOW xxxxxxxx IN RESPONSE TO THE ACCIDENT.  xxxx STATED THAT HE JUST LEFT HOME MOMENTS PRIOR, AND HIS FATHER xxxxxx HIM TO WATCH OUT FOR THE TRAFFIC WHILE RIDING HIS BICYCLE.  

THE BOSTON FIRE DEPARTMENT (xxxxxxx) WAS ALREADY ON-SCENE, AND BOSTON E.M.S. (xxxx) RESPONDED MINUTES LATER.  OFFICER xxxxxx MADE CONTACT WITH xxxx'S FATHER, ANGEL xxxxxx (xxxxxxxx), WHO WAS HOME AT xxx xxxx PARK AVENUE.  MR. xxx RESPONDED TO THE SCENE TO REFUSE MEDICAL ATTENTION FOR xxxx.  SGT. xxxxxxxxx, xxxx, RESPONDED TO THE SCENE.

OFFICER xxxxxx SPOKE TO TWO ANONYMOUS FEMALE WITNESSES, WHO WERE WAITING AT THE BUS STOP ON THE CORNER OF xxxxxxxxxx ST. AND xxxx PARK AVENUE, WHEN THE INCIDENT OCCURRED.  THEY STATED THAT THEY SAW EVERYTHING THAT HAPPENED.  THEY BOTH AGREED THAT THE TRUCK WAS CROSSING xxxx PARK AVENUE FROM xxxxxxxxxx STREET TOWARD xxxxxxx HWY.  THEY STATED THAT xxxx WAS TRAVELING ON HIS BICYCLE ON THE SIDEWALK ON xxxx PARK AVENUE, ATTEMPTING TO CROSS xxxxxxxxxx STREET, TRAVELING SOUTH.  THEY STATED THAT xxxx WAS NOT LOOKING AS HE CROSSED THE STREET, AND THE TRUCK "BUMPED" HIM, AND xxxx FELL OVER ON THE BICYCLE.  THE STATED THAT IT LOOKED LIKE THE TRUCK WOULD KEEP GOING, BUT THEY SAW A WHITE MALE EXIT THE TRUCK AND STOP TO SEE IF xxxx WAS OKAY.  xxxx WAS NOT WEARING A BICYCLE HELMET AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.  THE BICYCLE WAS NOT DENTED OR DAMAGED AS A RESULT OF THE ACCIDENT.  

THIS INCIDENT WAS NOT A SCHOOL CROSSING RELATED INCIDENT.  xxxx WAS NOT ON FOOT, HE WAS NOT TRAVELING TO OR FROM SCHOOL.  HE WAS AT HOME PRIOR TO RIDING HIS BICYCLE.  OFFICER xxxxxx WAS ADVISED THAT A CROSSING GUARD IS PRESENT IN THAT AREA AFTER xxxxxx.

FULL_ADDRESS: 877 Commonwealth Ave Allston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxx, on Thursday xxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxxxxx responded to a radio call in the xxxxx unit for a m/v accident with injuries at xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx St.
On arrival, officer spoke with the victim above, xxxxx Martin. The victim stated to the officer that he was operating his bicycle on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave., outbound, and was in the bicycle lane, when the m/v above, being operated by the suspect above took a right turn from xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave. onto Buick St. directly in front of the path of the victim on the bicycle. causing the victim and his bicycle to come into collision with the m/v above. The victim stated that the suspect made the right turn without making use of his flashing indicator lights.
The victim stated that he was experiencing pain in his left hand, and H&H unit xxx responded to the scene and examined the victim, gave ice for the victim's left hand, but the victim refused transport to the hospital. Boston Fire Dept. Ladder xx also responded to the scene. Also responding to the scene were the xxxx, Sgt. xxxxxx xxxxxx, and detail officer xxxxxx xxxxxxxx, who were performing a detail at the xxxxxxx xxxxx. Sgt. xxxxxx did observe the collision, but Officer xxxxxxxx did not.
The suspects m/v sustained minor scratches to the front bumper of the vehicle, but was driven from the scene by the owner. Neither the owner or the passenger in his m/v complained of any injury during the incident, and the officer did not observe either party to have any visible signs of injury.
The victim and his bicycle were transported to the victims home by the officer because of the fact that the victim was unable to drive the bicycle due to his injuries.

FULL_ADDRESS: 774 Columbus Ave South End, Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx p.m. on Wednesday May xx, xxxx, Officer M. xxxxxxxx (ID#xxxxxx), while working as the xxxxx, responded to a radio call for a MV and bicycle accident at xxx Columbus Ave.

On arrival, Officer xxxxxxxx was assisted on-scene by xxxxxxxxxxx PD and Boston EMS (xxx).  Officer xxxxxxxx spoke with two witnesses (xxxxx and xxxxx) who stated that they observed the Mv (Mass Reg#xxxxxx) turning from Columbus Ave into the parking lot opposite xxx Columbus Ave.  Both witnesses (xxxxx and xxxxx) further stated that the MV and bicyclist (xxxx xxxxxxxxx) approached the driveway at the same time, both slowing down.  The witnesses (xxxxx and xxxxx) stated that at that time it appeared the MV was slowing down for the Bicyclist, but then continued to turn into the driveway into the path of the bicyclist (xxxxxxxxx).  The victim (xxxxxxxxx) stated that she thought the MV was slowing for her and she, in turn, continued her path down Columbus Ave.  The victim (xxxxxxxxx) swerved but was slightly struck by the front of the MV, falling off of her bicycle and it (the bike) going under the MV.  

The operator (xxxxx) of the MV stated that he observed the bicyclist (xxxxxxxxx) coming down the road but didn't think she was close.  The operator (xxxxx) stated that he made the turn into the driveway and before he knew it the bicyclist (xxxxxxxxx) was striking his vehicle. 

The Victim (xxxxxxxxx) refused medical attention (Boston EMS xxx) and was transported (with witness xxxxx) to her home at xx xxxxxx St by the xxxxx (xxxxxxx and xxxxxxxx).  The operator of the vehicle (xxxxx) refused medical attention and was released from the scene.  No injuries reported by either party, only damage to the bike.

FULL_ADDRESS: 868 Harrison Ave South End, Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx hours, officer xxxxxxx in the xxxxx responded to a radio call for a bicyclist struck at Harrison Ave and xxxxxxxxxxx St.

   Upon my arrival, officer observed members of Boston Fire (xx) evaluating the victim. Officer also observed the arrival of Boston EMS (xxxx - xxxxxxx, xxxxx) a short time later.

   Officer spoke to Mr. xxx Teal (xxx# xxxxxxxxx, xxx - xxxxxxxx) who identified himself as the operator of Massachusetts registration xxxxxx. Mr. xxx stated that he was traveling eastbound on Harrison Ave. before coming to a stop at the intersection of Harrison Ave and xxxxxxxxxxx Street. Mr. xxx stated that after coming to a stop, he proceeded forward and was struck on the passenger side front bumper area of his motor vehicle by a bicyclist who failed to stop for a stop sign as she was traveling northbound on xxxxxxxxxxx street. The bicyclist was identified as Ms. xxx xxxxx (xxx - xxxxxxxxxx). Mr. xxx stated that a witness stopped and gave him her phone number and stated that she observed the accident and would be willing to be listed as a witness. That individual identified herself as Ms. xxx Barrows (phone# (xxx) xxxxxxxx).

   Officer spoke to Ms. xxx xxxxx who identified herself as the bicyclist involved in the accident. Ms. xxx stated that she had been cut off by a dark colored xxxxxxx. as she was turning onto xxxxxxxxxxx St. from xxxxxx St. Ms. xxx stated that she proceeded on xxxxxxxxxxx St. (northbound) and noticed that the dark colored xxxxxxx. had been following her too closely. Ms. xxx stated that because she was concerned that the dark xxxxxxx. may strike her, she pedaled forward through the intersection and struck the front passenger side bumper area of Massachusetts registration xxxxxx as it was traveling (eastbound) through the intersection. Ms. xxx stated that she fell off of her bicycle and struck the back of her head on the pavement below. Ms. xxx stated that the operator of the xxxxxxx. (identified as Ms. xxx Barrows, xxx - xxxxxxx) drove by her and yelled "that's what you get!" before leaving the area. Ms. xxx was taken to Boston Medical center for treatment by Boston EMS (xxxx - xxxxxxx, xxxxx). 

   Officer spoke to Ms xxx Barrows (via telephone) who stated that she was cut off by a bicyclist (later identified as Ms. xxx xxxxx) as she was turning onto xxxxxxxxxxx street from xxxxxx street. Ms. xxx stated that she came to a stop behind a pick up truck that was stopped at the stop sign at the intersection of xxxxxxxxxxx st. and Harrison Ave. Ms. xxx stated that she then observed that cyclist pass her stopped motor vehicle on the right side and proceed through the stop sign without stopping. Ms. xxx stated that she observed the bicyclist strike Massachusetts registration xxxxxx on the passenger side as it was proceeding through the intersection. Ms. xxx stated that at no time did she exchange words with the victim.

   Officer spoke to Ms. xxx xxxxx (xxx - xxxxxxx) who stated that she did not witness the accident but did witness the victim xxxxxxxx the back of her head as if that area of her body was injured. Ms. xxx stated that she came upon the scene as she was jogging by. 

   Officer observed white colored scratch marks on the front passenger side bumper area of Massachusetts registration xxxxxx. The bicycle involved was a white colored bicycle. Officer did not observe any noticeable damage to the bicycle. Officer filed Massachusetts form CRA - xx.

ABOUT xxxx PM P.O. HENRY xxxxxxx xxxxx RESPONDED TO A RADIO CALL FOR A CHILD STRUCK BY A CAR AT xx xxxxxxxx WAY.  THE YOUNG GIRL WAS REPORTED TO BE UNINJURED, BUT E.M.S. WAS STILL RESPONDING TO CHECK ON HER WELL BEING.  
    UPON ARRIVAL, WITH BOSTON FIRE AND EMS, x xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx WAS FOUND WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY.  xxxxxx JUST HAD A MINOR ABRASION ON HER RIGHT ELBOW.  xxxxxx HAD BEEN RIDING A BIKE, AND DROVE ONTO THE ROADWAY NEAR xx xxxxxxxx.   AT THE SAME TIME, MR. xxx J. xxxx WAS DRIVING BY IN HIS xxxx PICK-UP TRUCK.  xxxxxx WAS NOT LOOKING AND ROLLED OUT ONTO THE ROAD.  SHE SAW THE TRUCK AT THE LAST MINUTE AND ATTEMPTED TO STEER OUT OF THE WAY.  THE BICYCLE HAS NO BRAKES.  xxxxxx CHOSE TO DROP THE BIKE, AND FELL TO THE GROUND TO AVOID BEING STRUCK.  SHE FELL ONTO THE PAVEMENT AND SCRAPED HER ELBOW.  THE BIKE WAS STILL FURTHER OUT IN THE ROADWAY.  MR. xxx WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN TIME.  THE FRONT TIRE OF HIS TRUCK RAN OVER THE FRONT WHEEL AND TIRE OF xxxxxx'S BIKE.  THE BIKE WAS DAMAGED, BUT xxxxxx WAS NOT STRUCK BY THE VEHICLE.  
    xxxxxx WAS TREATED WITH ONE BANDAGE TO HER ELBOW.  SHE DID NOT SEEK MEDICAL TREATMENT.  HER GRANDMOTHER AND THE FAMILY WILL SEEK MEDICAL TREATMENT AT A LATER TIME IF NECESSARY.  MR. xxx LICENSE IS VALID AND HIS VEHICLE IS REGISTERED AND INSURED BY SAFETY INSURANCE.

FULL_ADDRESS: 9 Milk St Central Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxxx on Monday, xxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxx (xxxxx) received a radio call for a pedestrian struck at Washington St and Milk St, Boston. 

On arrival, Officer xxxxxx observed a white female, who was identified as xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx, being attended to by the Boston Fire Department (xxx). Officer xxxxxx observed that xxxxxxxxxx was alert and conscious. 

Officer xxxxxx observed xxxxxxxxxx had a few abrasions on her left knee. Officer xxxxxx observed the Boston Fire Department bandage xxxxxxxxxx's knee. 

Officer xxxxxx informed the xxxx (Sgt xxxxxxxx) about the incident and condition of xxxxxxxxxx. 

Boston EMS (xxx: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) arrived on scene. 

xxxxxxxxxx stated that she was riding her bicycle against traffic on Washington St coming from City Hall towards Downtown Crossing. xxxxxxxxxx stated that as she was riding her bicycle on the side of Washington St, a pedestrian walked out in front of her causing her to swerve into the middle of Washington St. 

xxxxxxxxxx stated that when she swerved into the middle of the road, she had a head on collision with a taxi cab. xxxxxxxxxx stated that she and her bicycle were knocked to the ground. xxxxxxxxxx stated that she was not wearing a helmet. xxxxxxxxxx stated that she did not hit her head. 

Boston EMS cleaned her abrasions and placed a fresh bandage on her leg. xxxxxxxxxx refused further medical attention. Boston EMS advised her to keep her abrasions clean and that in the future she should wear a helmet when riding her bicycle. 

xxxxxxxxxx informed Officer xxxxxx that she rode an old dark green xxxxxxxx bicycle and believed that her front tire was slightly damaged from the incident. 

Officer xxxxxx gave xxxxxxxxxx a verbal warning and informed her that she was not supposed to ride her bicycle the wrong way on a one way street. 

Officer xxxxxx spoke with the operator of the motor vehicle (Independent Taxi, MA Reg: xxxxxxx, VIN#: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx). The operator was identified as xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx (xxx: xxxxxxxx). 

xxxxxxxx stated that he was driving his taxi cab slowly down Washington St from Franklin St towards State St. xxxxxxxx stated that as he was crossing Milk St, a bicyclist suddenly cut diagonally across Washington St and rode her bicycle right into his taxi cab head on. xxxxxxxx stated that he stopped. xxxxxxxx stated that she and her bicycle fell to the ground. xxxxxxxx stated that she got up and said, "Don't xxxxx about it. I'm okay." xxxxxxxx stated that he heard a xxxxxxxxx tell her to call police. 

Officer xxxxxx did not observe any damage to the motor vehicle. 

Officer xxxxxx did not issue a citation to xxxxxxxx. 

Both parties continued on their separate ways. 

Officer xxxxxx filled out Form xxxxxx.

Det. xxxxx), xxxx (Det. xxxxxx), xxxxx (xxxxxxxxxxx), xxxxx (xxxxxxx), Boston Fire, EMS unit #xxx, and EMS unit #xxx responded.

FULL_ADDRESS: 342 Blue Hill Ave Roxbury , MA, USA

FULL_ADDRESS: 254 Massachusetts Ave Fenway , MA, USA
Narrative:
ABOUT xxxxx ON FRIDAY xxxxxxxxxx OFFICER xxxxxxxx IN THE xxxxx RESPONDED TO A RADIO CALL ABOUT MVC PED AT xxx MASSACHUSETTS AV, SOUTH END.

ON ARRIVAL OFFICER OBSERVED THE VICTIM, xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx, SITTING ON THE SIDEWALK WITH BLOODY SCRAPE ON RIGHT KNEE AND VISIBLE RED BRUISE ON THE UPPER CHEST AREA.  VICTIM WAS COMPLAINING ABOUT CHEST AND RIGHT SHOULDER PAIN AND WAS UNABLE TO xxxxx HER RIGHT ARM.  

FIRE FROM xxxxxxx AND EMS FROM xxxx ARRIVED ON SCENE AND BEGAN TREATING THE VICTIM.  VICTIM WAS TRANSPORTED TO xxxxxxxx AND WOMEN HOSPITAL FOR FURTHER TREATMENT BY xxxx (xxxxxxx AND xxxxx).

OFFICER INTERVIEWED TWO WITNESSES ON SCENE - WITNESS x, xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx, AND WITNESS x, xxxxxx MYERS.  BOTH WITNESSES TOLD OFFICER THAT THEY OBSERVED THE COLLISION WHEN THE VEHICLE, MA REG# xxxxxx, ATTEMPTED TO DO A U-TURN ON MASSACHUSETTS AV AND COLLIDING WITH THE VICTIM WHO WAS OPERATING A BICYCLE.

OFFICER INTERVIEWED THE VICTIM WHO TOLD OFFICER THAT SHE AND THE VEHICLE WERE TRAVELING ON MASS AV TOWARDS CAMBRIDGE WHEN THE VEHICLE DECIDED TO MAKE A U-TURN FROM THE RIGHT LANE. VICTIM STATED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING ON THE LEFT LANE AND BELIEVED THAT THE VEHICLE SAW HER AND WOULD SLOW DOWN.  VICTIM STATED THAT THE VEHICLE DID NOT SLOW DOWN AND SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP RESULTING IN COLLISION.

OFFICER INTERVIEWED VEHICLE OPERATOR, xxxxxx xxxxx, WHO ADMITTED IN MAKING A U-TURN AND STATED THAT HE BELIEVED THAT THE VICTIM WOULD STOP.  AS A RESULT OF HIS INVESTIGATION OFFICER ISSUED THE FOLLOWING CITATION TO THE OPERATOR (xxxxxxxx): xxxxx "U TURN - FAIL TO YIELD TO ONCOMING TRAFFIC".

OFFICER OBSERVED FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE DENT ON MR xxx'S VEHICLE.  THE BICYCLE WAS ON THE GROUND AND APPEARED UNDAMAGED.

FORM xxxxxx WAS COMPLETED ON THE ACCIDENT.

FULL_ADDRESS: 2 Buick St Allston , MA, USA
Narrative:
Officer xxxxxxx (xxxxx) responded to a radio call for a motor vehicle accident involving a pedestrian at the intersection of xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave and University Ave, Boston.  Upon arrival officer observed Health & Hospitals Ambulance xxx arriving who immediately began treating the victim (later identified as xxxxx) on scene.  At this time, officer spoke with all witness' separately.  Witness x (xxxxxxx) stated the victim was riding her bicycle on the sidewalk along xxxxxxxxxxxx Av heading inbound and came to a complete stop at University Rd before crossing the street in front of the vehicle who did not see the victim.  Witness x stated the vehicle also came to a complete stop before proceeding onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Av before his vehicle struck the victim.   Witness xxx (xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx, riding together in the vehicle of witness x) both stated they observed both parties involved in the accident come to a complete stop at the intersection then both proceeded at the same time.  Both stated they observed the victim approach University Av while riding her bicycle (heading inbound) on the sidewalk of xxxxxxxxxxxx Av.
	Officer spoke with the operator (xxxxxxx) of the vehicle (xxx Chevy, MA registration xxxxxx) who stated he approached xxxxxxxxxxxx Av from University Rd and came to a complete stop before proceeding onto xxxxxxxxxxxx Av.  The operator stated as he began to proceed he did not see the victim to his right until it was too late.  His vehicle struck the victim and her bicycle knocking both onto the vehicle's hood then to the roadway.
	The officer spoke with victim (xxxxx) who stated she was traveling inbound on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave while riding her bicycle on the sidewalk.  The victim approached University Rd then came to a complete stop before entering the crosswalk.  The victim stated she observed a vehicle (later determined to be that of Mr. xxx's) approach the intersection and came to a complete stop.  The victim thought the operator (xxxxxxx) had seen her to his right so she began to cross in front but was struck as the vehicle also proceeded at the same time.
	The victim was transported to St. xxxxxxxxx's Hospital for further treatment for an injury to her right arm.  Based on information obtained by both parties and the three witness', the officer can determine the victim was riding her bicycle on the sidewalk while traveling the wrong way on xxxxxxxxxxxx Av and not in marked bicycle lanes present on xxxxxxxxxxxx Av.
	Boston Fire Ladder xx also responded.  District x patrol supervisor notified on channel x.

FULL_ADDRESS: 86 Joyce Hayes Way South Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
RESPONDED TO xxxxxxx ROGERS WAY FOR A CHILD STRUCK BY A MOTOR VEHICLE. ON ARRIVAL SPOKE WITH THE VICTIMS FATHER WHO STATED. HIS SON WAS RIDING HIS BIKE IN THE AREA OF ST. xxxxxxx ST AND xxxxxxx ROGERS WAY WHEN HE WAS STRUCK BY A WHITE TRUCK.  THE VICTIM WAS BROUGHT BACK TO HIS APARTMENT BY HIS FATHER AFTER THE ACCIDENT.   BOSTON HEALTH AND HOSPITALS AMB #x RESPONDED AND TREATED THE VICTIM  INSIDE THE APARTMENT FOR A SMALL LACERATION ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF HIS HEAD.  EMS PREPARED THE VICTIM FOR TRANSPORT TO BMC FOR FURTHER EVALUATION.  

OFFICERS INTERVIEWED A WITNESS (xxxxxx xxxxxxx) WHO STATED THE VICTIM WAS RIDING HIS BIKE HEADING OUTBOUND ON xxxxxxx ROGERS WAY WHEN HE GOT TO THE INTERSECTION OF xxxxxxxxxxx AND xxxxxxx ROGERS HE WAS STRUCK BY THE TRUCK THAT WAS IN THE INTERSECTION.  THE OPERATOR OF THE TRUCK EXITED THE VEHICLE AND SPOKE WITH THE VICTIMS FATHER PRIOR TO LEAVING THE SCENE.  THE WITNESS STATES THE FATHER TOLD THE OPERATOR TO LEAVE.  

OFFICERS INTERVIEWED THE OPERATOR VIA PHONE APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR LATER.  HE STATES THE VICTIM WAS RIDING WITH TWO OTHER KIDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STREET ON xxxxxxx ROGERS WAY.  ALL THREE KIDS WERE HEADING OUTBOUND ON xxxxxxx ROGERS WITH THE VICTIM IN THE LEAD.  THE OPERATOR WAS OPERATING A THIRTY FOOT FLAT BED TRUCK AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO MAKE A RIGHT TURN ONTO xxxxxxx ROGERS WAY WHEN HE xxxxxxx THE KIDS RIDING TOWARD HIM.  THE VICTIM WAS IN THE LEAD AND TWO OTHER CYCLIST FOLLOWING IN CLOSE xxxxxxx.  THE TRUCK OPERATOR STOPPED THE TRUCK IN THE INTERSECTION TO ALLOW THE KIDS TO PASS IN FRONT OF THE VEHICLE BUT THE VICTIM CHOSE TO xxxxxxx BETWEEN THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE TRUCK AND THE SIDEWALK AT THE INTERSECTION.  THE VICTIM RAN INTO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE xxxxxxx OF THE TRUCK ABOUT FOUR FEET DOWN THE LENGTH OF THE VEHICLE.  THE OPERATOR AND HIS PASSENGERS EXITED THE VEHICLE AND FOUND THE VICTIM LYING UNDER THE xxxxxxx PORTION OF THE TRUCK.  

THE OPERATOR AND HIS PASSENGERS RETRIEVED THE VICTIM FROM UNDERNEATH THE VEHICLE AND ATTEMPTED TO LOCATE THE VICTIMS PARENTS BY ASKING PEOPLE WHO HAVE NOW GATHERED IN THE AREA TO SEE WHAT WAS GOING ON.  FIVE MINUTES LATER THE VICTIMS FATHER APPEARED AND REMOVED THE VICTIM FROM THE SCENE.  THE OPERATOR ATTEMPTED SEVERAL TIMES TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION WITH THE FATHER BUT THE FATHER TOLD THE OPERATOR NOT TO xxxxx ABOUT IT.  WHEN THE OPERATOR RETURNED TO THE xxxxxxxx OFFICE HE REPORTED THE ACCIDENT TO OFFICE PERSONNEL AND FILED A ACCIDENT REPORT AT THE OFFICE. 

INCIDENT FORWARDED TO THE AUTO INVESTIGATOR FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION.

About xxxxx P.M., on Thursday, on xxxxxxxxxx, Officer Gill in the xxxxx unit, responded to a radio call to assist the xxxx unit (Hackney Unit) for a Struck Pedestrian, at Atlantic xxxxxxxxxxxxxx St.

 Upon arrival Officer observed the xxxx unit (Officer Ward and Officer xxxx) on scene. Officer Ward informed Officer Gill that a bicyclist was struck by an opened passenger door of a taxi cab. Officer Gill spoke with the Victim (Heather xx xxxxx (xxxxxxx. xxxxxxxx) who stated that she was on her bicycle traveling down Atlantic xxxxxxxxxxxx St in the middle of the two lanes. Ms. xxx stated that a taxi cab was the second motor vehicle in the left hand lane stopped at a red light at Atlantic  xxxxxxxxxxxxxx St. She further stated that the passenger's door of the taxi cab swung open and struck her bicycle causing her to fall off the bicycle and to land on the right side of her body. 

 Officer spoke with the Passenger of the taxi cab (xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx, xxxxxxx. xxxxxxxx) who stated that the taxi cab was on Atlantic Ave. in the left hand lane stopped at a red light. She stated that she paid the cab driver and told him that she was getting out of the taxi cab. Ms. xxx further informed Officer that the taxi cab driver acknowledged the fact that she was exiting out the taxi cab. She stated that when she opened the passenger's right side rear door it struck a bicyclist.

 Officer spoke with the Operator (xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxx. xxxxxxxx) of the Taxi Cab (xxxxxxx Reg. xxxxxxx, Toyota Camry, sedan, white in color) who stated that he was on Atlantic Ave. in the left hand lane stopped at a red light behind another motor vehicle. Mr. xxx stated that the passenger gave him the money and just got out of the cab. He informed Officer that he was unaware that she was going to open the door and get out in the middle of the street.

 Officer Gill spoke with Officer Ward in the xxxx unit (Hackney Unit)  who stated that he did not cite the taxi cab driver. 

 Victim (Heather xxxxxxx) was transported by Emts xxxxxx and xxxxxxxxx in the xxxx unit to MGH for complaint of pain to her right side of body.

Pedestrian was conscious, alert, and coherent. Officer xxxxxx spoke with the operator (xxxxxx, xxxxxx) of MA REG# xxxxxx (xxxxxxx Highlander, xxxx). xxxxxx stated he was traveling down xxxxxxx St. toward xxxxxx Av. xxxxxx further stated he came to a stop at the stop light located at xxxxxxx St and xxxxxx Av. Once the light changed to green xxxxxx proceeded to turn left onto xxxxxx Av. At that point xxxxxx stated a pedestrian on a bicycle came down xxxxxxxxx Rd and was headed directly toward his vehicle. xxxxxx stated the bicycle did not appear to be slowing down so xxxxxx attempted to speed up a little in order to avoid hitting the bicyclist. xxxxxx was unable to avoid the collision. The vehicle sustained damage to the rear driver side door, and a broken rear driver window. Vehicle was operated from the scene.

    Officer xxxxxx was then able to speak with victim (xxxxxxxx) who stated he was riding his bicycle down xxxxxxxxx Rd toward xxxxxx Av. xxxxxxxx stated it felt like xxxxxxxxx Rd was on a decline toward xxxxxx Av. xxxxxxxx further stated he was traveling at a high rate of speed and upon approaching the intersection he panicked. Upon his xxxxx xxxxxxxx failed to xxxxxxx the bicycles brakes. xxxxxxxx collided head first into the rear driver side window of the vehicle, causing the window to shatter and break. xxxxxxxx's bicycle damaged the rear driver side door. xxxxxxxx sustained a head injury and was transported to Boston Medical Center for further treatment by Boston EMS xxx.

FULL_ADDRESS: 228 Massachusetts Ave Fenway , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxxxx on Thursday xxxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxxx (xxxxx unit) responded to a radio call for a report of a bicyclist struck outside xxx Mass Av.

   On arrival officer observed the victim (later identified as xxxxx xxx) being treated by Health & Hospitals ambulance #xxxx (EMT's Berger & xxxxxxxxxxx). Also on-scene was The Boston fire Department ladder xx and engine xx.

   The victim at this time was transported to The Boston Medical Center emergency room to be treated for injuries to his mouth (missing teeth), a fractured left wrist and multiple abrasions to his shoulders.

   Officer then spoke to (witness) xxxxxx xxxxxx who stated that she heard the suspect m/v screeching it's tires and observed it traveling at a high rate of speed southbound on Mass Av. The witness then heard the collision and observed that the suspect m/v had struck a bicyclist and fled the scene. 

   Officer also spoke to another witness on-scene who stated that the suspect m/v was traveling at a high rate of speed while changing lanes multiple times in an attempt to pass other m/v traffic. The suspect m/v was described as a dark colored sedan possibly a toyota camry or xxxxxx. No registration number was observed but the suspect m/v was observed traveling southbound on Mass Av after the accident.

   Officer also observed that a parked xxx shuttle bus (registration #xxxxxx) sustained damage to a rear brake light possibly caused by the bicycle striking it. Officer located the operator of the bus and informed him of the damage.

   Officer then observed two of the victims teeth underneath the rear of the bus and retrieved them. Officer also took custody of the victims bicycle which will be held for safekeeping at xxx.

   Officer while on-scene broadcast a description of the suspect m/v and it's last known direction. Officer then responded to the BMC and forwarded the victims teeth to the staff in the emergency room. The victim was conscious and alert at the hospital and was being treated by Dr xxxxxxx.

   Officer also observed that there are multiple security cameras in the area including church Park which may have recorded the accident. xxxx notified, xxxxxx completed.

At about xxxxxx on Thursday xxxxxxxxxx, Officers xxxxxx and xxxxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for an assault & battery in progress at xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave.

Upon arrival, the officers met with the caller/victim xxxxxxxx, xxxxx (W/M xxxxxxxxxxxxxx) and a witness xxxxx, Beth (W/F xxxxxxxxxxxxxx) on scene at the BU Bridge. The officers observed the victim, who appeared very upset, asked if he wanted to be treated by EMS but refused. The victim (xxxxxxxx) stated that he was riding his bicycle inbound on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave when he had to get around a truck that was double parked on the bike lane. The victim (xxxxxxxx) stated that he made his way around the double parked truck and continued in the same direction. The victim stated that a driver/suspect that was beside him (described as a W/M, early xx's, approx xxx lbs, xxxxxx build, bald head, blue xxxxxxxx shirt, shorts and xxxxxxx on his right arm operating a Blue xxxx Dodge xxxxxxx sedan xxxxxx xxxxxx), ran a red light to catch up with him and began weaving between the right lane and the bicycle lane to force him off the road. The victim stated he tried to maintain control on the bicycle lane while the suspect deliberately attempted to hit him with his vehicle. The victim stated that the suspect eventually sped up ahead of him and opened his passenger side door in time to cause the victim to collide with it and fall over onto the street near the intersection of xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave and BU Bridge. The victim stated that the suspect then exited his vehicle and took a xxxxx at the victim. The victim stated that the suspect then got back into his vehicle, made a u-turn going onto the opposite side of the road and traveled west (outbound) on xxxxxxxxxxxx Ave. The victim stated that the suspect was operating a blue or xxxxxxx Dodge xxxxxxx. The victim also stated that he wasn't sure if there was any damage to his bicycle, but it appeared xxxxxxxxxx will have it evaluated later.

Officer xxxxxxxx ran the information gathered about the suspect's vehicle on the MDT and discovered that the vehicle's registration matched a blue Dodge xxxxxxx sedan owned by a man named Potter, xxxxxx (W/M xxxxxxxxxxxxxx). Mr. xxx stated there was no damage to his bicycle and when asked by Sgt. xxxxxxx if he needed medical attention he stated he did not. Upon Officers arrival, Officers were approached by the victim who identified himself as xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx who stated that while riding his bike on Washington St., he was struck by a motor vehicle when attempting to cross the intersection at Washington St., and xxxxxxxx St. Officers then asked the Victim (xxxxxxxxx) who struck him, and he pointed at a gray Toyota xxxxxxx and said "The woman in that car" Officers then asked the victim (xxxxxxxxx) if he needed medical attention to which he declined. The victim stated that he bumped his elbow, and although it was a little sore, he was fine. The victim also stated that did not want the woman to get in trouble, he only wanted her to pay for the damages to his bike.

As officers approached the gray Toyota, a woman got out and approached them, and identified herself as xxxxx xxxxxxxx. Officer xxxxx then asked the suspect (xxxxxxxx) what happened, and she replied that she was at the red light at xxxxxxxx and Washington, and that when the light turned green she stepped on the gas, and the victim darted out in front of her, and she struck him. Officer xxxxx then asked the suspect (xxxxxxxx) if she looked before stepping on the gas to which she replied, "No, I didn't think I would have to look if I have the green light." Both officers then explained to the suspect (xxxxxxxx) that no matter what, she should always check to make sure that the intersection is clear when a red light turns green before proceeding, to which she agreed.

Officers then asked the suspect if she required medical attention to which she declined. Officer xxxxx then ran the suspects name, and license in the department cruiser MDT to which the license came back active, negative on xxxxxxxx, and the vehicle was actively registered. The suspect offered to give the victim a ride home to which he xxxxxxxx. Both parties stated that they would work out the money situation for the damages to the victims bike xxxxxxx themselves.

Truck operator stated to officer that after the incident the bicycle operator got up off the ground and stated that she felt "ok" and that witness # x stated to him that for $xx or $xx dollars the matter could be taken care of or words to that xxxxxx. Officer xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx informed dispatch that x Officers were injured.  Ambulance unit #xx (xxxxxxxxxxxx) responded. EMS transported both Officers to xxxxxxxx Hospital for further medical treatment. Officer spoke to witness #x, xxxxxxx xxxxxx (xxx xxxxxxxx), who stated that he was walking on Centre St. when he heard a collision and when he turned around, he observed Officer xxxxx flip over his bike and fall onto the ground. The victim stated that when he passed xxxxxxxxxx St he rode his bicycle into the cross walk when he heard a vehicle engine xxxxxxx and tires screeching. The victim stated that he was unable to get out of the way and the vehicle struck his back tire xxxxxxxxx him onto the sidewalk where he hit an xxxxxxxxxx box and a light pole. The victim stated that he then got up from the ground and observed a black male who he described as a xxxx black male about xx years of age standing on the corner. The victim stated that the man stated to him "I didn't hit you". The victim stated that the man then got into a red Mitsubishi that he was able to xxxx the registration off as Ma Reg xxxxxx. The officer then ran the vehicle and discovered that it was in fact registered to a red Mitsubishi xxxxxx with xxxxxxxx xxxxxx Listed as the owner. The victim informed the officer that he could not move his right arm from his elbow xxxxxxxxx officer requested Boston EMS to the scene. 

The officer was then approached by Witness xxxxxx xxxxxxxx who stated that he was parked sitting inside of his vehicle  on Blue Hill Ave at the corner of xxxxxxxxxx St. Witness xxxxxxxx stated he observed the same vehicle which was traveling in the same direction as the victim take a right turn onto xxxxxxxxxx St while traveling very fast. The witness stated that the front of the vehicle hit the victims bicycles back tire sending him flying onto the sidewalk where he hit an xxxxxxxxxx box and a light pole. Witness xxxxxxxx stated that the operator who he described as a xxxx black male wearing a green shirt stopped the vehicle on xxxxxxxxxx St and got out. The witness stated that the suspect looked at the victim and stated "I Didn't hit you" and began to walk back towards his car. The witness stated that he walked behind him and informed the man that he did in fact hit the victim. The witness stated that the man again stated that he did not hit him then got into his vehicle and drove up xxxxxxxxxx St towards Blue Hill Ave.

The officer observed the victims Bicycle (Gray xxxxxx Broadway xxxxxxxxxxx silver in color) to have its back wheel bent almost in half and crushed into the frame of the bike. Boston EMS Unit xxxx EMT's xxxxxx and xxxxxxx arrived on scene and transported the suspect to the Boston Medical Center.

FULL_ADDRESS: 32 Batterymarch St Central Boston , MA, USA
Narrative:
About  xxxxxx Officer xxxxx assigned to the xxxxx car responded to  radio call to the intersection of xxxxxxxxxxxx and Milk Streets for a xxxxxxxxxxxx accident.  The officer spoke to both parties involved.  
     Mr xxx xxxxxxxx states while riding his bike, he was struck on the front right side, by a cab.  The impact knocked xxxxxxxx to the pavement and caused damage to his bike.  xxxxxxxx first encountered the cab at Post Office Square on xxxxx Street.  The cab followed him closely until the two were stopped at a stop sign at xxxxxxxxxxxx and Milk Street.  xxxxxxxx fearing for his safety and because the cab had been following him too closely, tapped on the side of the cab and stated "That's how people get xxxxxx".  xxxxxxxx then proceeded through the stop sign, turning left onto Milk Street.  He was over taken on the right side by the cab approximately twenty yards from the stop sign.  The cab struck his front tire on the right side causing him to fall from the bike, landing in the middle of the street.
   xxxxxxxx was treated on scene by H&H ambulance but refused to be taken to a treatment facility. He states he was not injured at this time.  His bike had white paint on the right side of the front tire, consistent with his version of the incident.  The bike was left with its owner.  estimate cost for repairs are xxxxxxxxxxxx at this time.
    Mr xxx xxxx states he first saw a bicyclist on xxxxxxxxxxxx Street ( as he operated: Boston Cab, Ma. reg xxxxxxx, self insured) xxxxxxxxxx weaving in and out of the line of cars in front of him with no regards for his safety.  On one xxxxxxxx coming within inches of his cab. At the stop sign at the intersection of Milk and xxxxxxxxxxxx, both the cyclist and the cab made the left turn together.  About twenty yards from the intersection, on Milk Street, the front bumper of the cab came in contact with the rear tire of the bike.  The impact knocking the cyclist to the ground.
     There did not appear to be any damage to the cab, it was left in the custody of the operator.  xxx complained of no injuries at this time.
The victim was unable to provide the officer with an e-mail address.
Registry of Mv crash form xx filed.

Witness x (xxxxx xxxxxx, xxx xxxxxxxx) stated to officers that she yelled "Stop" because she saw her sister, Victim x (xxxxxx,) driving down the xxxxxxxx driveway next to xx xxxxxxxxxx Drive and feared she would crash into the xxxx Honda. The bicycle was still leaning against the left front quarter panel of the xxxx Honda when the officer arrived on scene. The officer observed dents to the left front quarter panel and a spider web crack to the driver side windshield of the xxxx Honda. The bicycle had a bent front frame. Officer xxxxxxxx (xxxx) notified. Boston EMS unit xxx responded to the scene and transported Victim x (xxxxxx) and her mother, xxxxxx xxxxxx (xxx xxxxxxxx), to Children's Hospital. FULL_ADDRESS: 52 Corey St West Roxbury , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx AM on Monday, August xx, xxxx, Officer xxxxxx and Officer Ho in the xxxxx were at the intersection of xxxxx and Centre Street, West Roxbury conducting Operation Crosswalk. While observing traffic, Officer xxxxxx looked in his driver's side rear view mirror and observed a male lying on the crosswalk next to a bicycle. It appeared as if the male had just been struck by a motor vehicle. 

Upon arrival at the intersection, the officers observed a blue Honda Civic (MA Reg xxxxxx) pull over and exit the vehicle. The driver (xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx) stated that she was driving outbound on the right lane of Centre Street, stopped at a red light, and when it turned, her vehicle was struck by the bicyclist, whom came out of no where. The officers spoke with the operator of the bicyclist (xxxxx xxxxxxxx) who stated that he was struck by the blue Honda Civic. Mr. xxx had removed both his shoes and stated that he was experiencing some discomfort in his right ankle. The officers observed Mr. xxx visibly limping around. Mr. xxx was not wearing a helmet, and the officers did not observe one at the scene. The xxxx (Sergeant xxxxxx) arrived on scene and asked Mr. xxx if he would like an ambulance, but Mr. xxx stated that he thought he would be okay. Sergeant xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx requested an ambulance to examine Mr. xxx.

The officers spoke with witness #x (xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx) who stated that he was across the street and observed the bicyclist (Mr. xxx) weaving in and out of traffic. Witness #x stated that Mr. xxx was riding outbound on the yellow line of Centre Street and quickly cut across as if to take a right on xxxxx Street. Witness #x stated that the operator of the blue Honda Civic was stopped at a red light and when the light turned, the driver began to accelerate, at which point the bicyclist hit the left front bumper of the vehicle.

The officers spoke with witness #x (xxxxxx xxxxxx) who stated that he was in the first vehicle stopped at the red light on Centre Street traveling inbound and observed the accident. Witness #x stated that he observed the bicyclist weaving in and out of traffic, traveling outbound on Centre Street. Witness #x stated that he observed the bicyclist riding the yellow line and then quickly cut across the blue Honda Civic, as if to take a right onto xxxxx Street. Witness #x stated that the Honda Civic was stopped at the red light and was going approximately one mile per hour when the accident occurred.

Mr. xxx was placed on a stretcher and transported by ambulance xxxx to the xxxxxxxx Hospital for evaluation. Ms. xxx refused medical treatment. The officers transported Mr. xxx's bicycle back to district xxx for safekeeping. The officers filled out xxxxx. Witness #x, xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx, stated that she was operating her motor vehicle (MA. xxxxxxxxxxx) on Tremont street heading towards Columbus avenue, when she did observe the victim ride his bicycle into traffic on Tremont street.  Witness #x further stated that she had to slam on her brakes in order to avoid hitting the victim, and she then saw the victim collide with a motor vehicle that was next to her in the other lane of traffic.

Witness #x, xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx, stated that he observed the victim ride his bicycle off the curb and into traffic, and did observe the first motor vehicle that was being operated by Witness #x stop short in order to avoid the victim, then saw the victim collide with another motor vehicle.  Witness #x also stated that it appeared that the motor vehicle that was involved in the accident slammed on its brake in an attempt to avoid hitting the victim.

The motor vehicle that collided with the victim was being operated by xxxx xxxxxx who remained on-scene.  Mr. xxx stated that he was operating his motor vehicle (MA. Reg. xxxxxx) on Tremont street heading towards Columbus avenue when the victim came out of now where and struck the front passenger's side headlight area of his motor vehicle.  Mr. xxx stated that he did not see the victim until the last second and that is when he attempted to slam on the brakes so that he wouldn't collide with the victim.  Mr. xxx further stated that the victim had struck his motor vehicle.

While officers were xxxxxxxx the scene they did observe a Hispanic male, later identified as xxxx xxxxxxx (xxx xxxxxxxxxx), taking pictures of the crime scene and leaning over the crime scene xxxx that had been put in place by responding officers.  Mr. xxx was informed that by leaning into the crime scene area he was now part of the investigation and that was why his information was being collected.

Boston EMS xxxxx (xxxxxx and xxxxx) responded to the scene and transported the victim to Brigham and Women's Hospital.  The victim was suffering from serious bodily injuries.  At the time the report was completed the suspect was in critical but stable condition.

The xxxxx unit (P.O. xxxxxxx) and the xxxx (P.O. Harrison) did respond to the scene for an accident reconstruction investigation.  xxxxx unit did take possession of the victim's bicycle for further investigation.

The victim's xxxxxxxxxx were left at the scene and were logged into evidence at District x. The victim's wallet contained $xxxxxx in US xxxxxxxx.  A seized money form was completed and the money was also logged into evidence at District x.

The motor vehicle (MA. Reg. xxxxxx) was towed from the scene by Auto Service and Tire (Slip #xxxxx).  The tow lot was notified (xxxxxx).  Form xxxx was completed and the District x tow log was completed.

Other responding units were xxxx (xxx. xxxxxxxx), xxxx (Sgt. Det. xxxxxxxxx), xxxx (Det. xxxxxx), xxxx (Det. xxxxx), xxxxx (P.O. xxxxxxxx), xxxxx (P.O. xxxxxxx), xxxxx (P.O. xxxxxx), xxxxx (P.O. xxxxxxx) xxxx (P.O. Harrison) and detail officer xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

FULL_ADDRESS: 434 S Huntington Ave Jamaica Plain , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxxx, on Monday, xxxxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxx in the xxxxx responded to a radio call for an injured female that had been struck by a bus at the corner of South Huntington Avenue and Moraine Street, Jamaica Plain.

Upon arrival the officer observed a Massachusetts Bay Transit xxxxxxxxx (MBTA) bus (Bus #xxxx, Route xx) stopped in the roadway in front of xxx South Huntington Avenue. The officer then observed a white ten speed bicycle on the ground under the passenger side bumper of the bus. The officer then approached the bus and located the victim (later identified as xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx) sitting in the passenger xxxxxxx of the bus. The victim (xxxxxxxxx) was conscious and alert. xxxxxxxxx's only complaint of injury was a sore right elbow and sore right ankle. The officer then confirmed that an ambulance was on it's way to provide medical attention for xxxxxxxxx. 

xxxxxxxxx then stated to the officer that she had been riding in the bicycle lane on South Huntington Avenue when she saw the bus begin to stop for a vehicle waiting to take a left into the xxxx parking lot. xxxxxxxxx then stated that she attempted to make a left across the street in front of the bus. Just after xxxxxxxxx exited the bicycle lane, the bus proceeded on it's original path of travel, striking her and knocking her to the ground. Ambulance xxxx (with EMTs xxxxxxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxx and xxxxx) arrived on scene to provide medical attention to xxxxxxxxx.

At that time, the officer spoke to the bus operator (xxxxx xxxxxxx) who stated that he was driving down South Huntington Avenue when he observed a vehicle in the roadway in front of him, stopped and waiting to take a left turn into the parking lot of xxxx. As he approached the vehicle, the vehicle executed the left turn. Instead of coming to a complete stop, he proceeded forward. At that time, a female on a bicycle exited the bike lane moving left, directly into the path of his bus. The bus operator (xxxxxxx) xxxxxxx applied the bus' breaks and veered left in an attempt to avoid striking the bicyclist, but could not and his bus struck the bicyclist, knocking her to the ground.

At that time MBTA Inspector xxxxxxx (#xxxx), MBTA Police xxxx xxxxxxxxx, MBTA Police Sgt. xxxxxx and MBTA Police Officer xxxxxx arrived on scene to conduct their investigation.

Ambulance xxxx then transported xxxxxxxxx to Brigham and Women's hospital for further medical treatment.

The male reported to the officer that he was the boy's xxxxxx and that after calling xxx, he was told to keep boy sitting on the ground until the ambulance arrived.  He said that they (he and the mother) wanted the boy to be taken and check out at the hospital.

Morris while assigned to the xxxxx unit received a radio call for a report for a pedestrian struck by a motor vehicle at the intersection of Blue Hill Ave and xxxxxxxx St Dorchester, Ma. Morris then spoke with victim #x xxxxxx who stated that he did not understand English very well and at this point victim #x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxx came forward stating that he was also injured in the accident.  Victim #x xxxxxxx then translated (Spanish to English) for victim #x xxxxxx. Victim #x xxxxxx complained of pain to his right ankle and victim #x xxxxxxx complained of pain to his back and right wrist. FULL_ADDRESS: 4183 Washington St Roslindale , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxx hrs on xxxxxxxx, Officer xxxxxx in the xxxxx unit responded to a radio call for a bicyclist struck by a motor vehicle at the intersection of xxxxxx Rd and Washington St.

Upon arrival, Officers observed victim, (xxxx,xxxxx) on the ground with facial trauma from the accident.  Health & Hospitals EMT's (xxxxxxxxxxxxxx) were also on scene and administering medical treatment to said victim.  Ms. xxx was then transported to Brigham & Women's Hospital for further medical evaluation.  Emt's stated she received facial lacerations and bruising from the impact and lost several teeth.  Officer spoke to victim briefly to ascertain her identify but was unable to get her recollection of said accident.  

Officer xxxxxx was then approached by several witnesses listed above who all concurred that the operator of MA Reg xxxxxxx, later identified as xxxxxxxx xxxxxx, (further info above), had already turned onto xxxxxx Rd from Washington St. when the victim on her bike slammed into the rear passenger side door area causing van door to dent.  Witness xxxxx xxxxxx further stated that he was traveling inbound on Washington St. and observed MA Reg xxxxxxx stopped on the outbound side of Washington St, with it's left turn indicator activated, waiting to make a left turn onto xxxxxx Rd.  Witness xxxxxx stated he stopped in his lane to allow Ms. xxx to turn left when he observed victim (xxxx) pass him on his xxxxxxxxxx bicycle lane and strike Ms. xxx's van.  Witness xxxxxx xxxxxxx states she was on foot and approaching the intersection of Washington St. & xxxxxx Rd. when she stopped before stepping into the crosswalk to allow Ms. xxx's van to complete her turn that she was already in progress of making.  At that point, Witness xxxxxxx stated she did not even see the victim on her left side until she had struck the rear side passenger area of said van. Witness xxxxxxxxxx states he observed the van turning left onto xxxxxx Rd when he saw the victim pass the stopped traffic on the inbound side of Washington St.  He further states said traffic was allowing Ms. xxx to turn onto xxxxxx Rd. and victim, without stopping, slammed into the rear passenger side of the van.   

Operator of van (xxxxxxxx xxxxxx) stated she was stopped on the outbound side of Washington St. with her left turn signal on waiting to turn left onto xxxxxx Rd.  She further states when the inbound traffic lane stopped to allow her to turn, she did not observe any persons traveling in the inbound bicycle lane near said intersection.  She further states she proceeded with her turn when she heard a loud bang near the rear passenger side door area.  She further states the force of the impact caused her rear passenger door to suddenly come ajar.   Ms. xxx immediately pulled over and observed victim on the ground, bleeding from the facial area and mouth.  She observed several teeth on the ground near victim and collected them in xxxxx bandages while awaiting medical assistance.  

Officer xxxxxx took custody of victim's bike after xxxxxxxxxx her husband (xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx) via phone who stated he will pick it up at Dist. xx.  Officer observed damages to bicycle's front tire and frame.  Auto Investigator, P.O. xxxxxxxxx (xxxx) was notified.  Also responding on scene were xxxx (xxxxxx), xxxxx (Younger) & xxxxx (Ho).

FULL_ADDRESS: 706 Morton St Mattapan , MA, USA
Narrative:
About xxxxxx on Thursday xxxxxxxx xx, xxxx, Officer xxxxxxx (xxxxx) was at the intersection of Blue Hill Ave and xxxxxx St when he was flagged down by motorists and pedestrians, who stated that a man on a bicycle was just struck by a motor vehicle and that vehicle had fled the scene. The motorist to the left of Officer xxxxxxx yelled out, "that white colored van just hit that man on the bike". Officer xxxxxxx looked into his left side mirror and noticed a light  xxxxxxx colored van traveling up Blue Hill Avenue towards xxxxxxxx Square at a high rate of speed.

Officer xxxxxxx then noticed xxxxxxx xxxxx (victim) on the ground next to his bicycle at the intersection of Blue hill avenue and xxxxxx street being helped back up to his feet and then Officer xxxxxxx made a u-turn and pulled up along side xxxxxxx and asked him if he was injured. xxxxxxx stated that he was not injured but pointed down Blue Hill Avenue towards xxxxxxxx Square saying that he was just hit by that gray colored van. Officer xxxxxxx looked up Blue Hill Avenue again to see if the van was still visible and decided to pursue it. Officer xxxxxxx noticed the van took a right turn onto Wellington Hill Street and continued up the hill until Officer xxxxxxx caught up and performed a traffic stop at the intersection of Wellington Hill Street and xxxxxxxxx Road.

The driver of the van (xxxxxxx xxxxx) exited the vehicle and Officer xxxxxxx asked him to step onto the sidewalk and asked him if he had a drivers license. xxxxxxx xxxxx handed to Officer xxxxxxx a Massachusetts ID Card then Officer xxxxxxx asked him if he xxxxxxxxx a drivers license in which he stated that he did not. Officer xxxxxxx asked xxxxxxx if he knew that he had just struck someone at the intersection of Blue Hill Ave and xxxxxx Street and stated that he did not. xxxxxxx xxxxx then stated that he was on his way to work and had two other people with him in the vehicle (xxxxxx xxxxxx and xxxx xxxxxxx). Officer xxxxxxx asked the two other occupants to step out of the vehicle and asked them if they had any type of identification on their persons. Both xxxxxx and xxxx produced ID's, were queried on the Mobile Data Terminal and were cleared.

Officer xxxxxxx then asked the other two passengers if they had noticed that they had hit someone crossing the crosswalk at the intersection of Blue Hill Avenue and xxxxxx Street, then xxxxxx xxxxxx stated that he did notice the bicyclist attempting to cross the street but somewhat jump in front of their vehicle. xxxxxx then stated that he saw the man fall off the bicycle but did not think he was struck by the vehicle.

Officer xxxxxxx queried xxxxxxx xxxxx on the Mobile Data Terminal and found xxxxxxx to have a suspended license. Officer xxxxxxx then discovered xxxxxxx xxxxx to have a default xxxxxxx out of xxxxxxxxx District Court (xxxxxx # xxxxxxxxxxxx). Contacted xxxxxxx Unit via xxx.

Officer xxxxxxx then placed xxxxxxx xxxxx under arrest and transported him and was xxxxxxxx by Officer xxxxxx (xxxxx) to xxx station in xxxxxxxx for booking where he was charged with, xxxxxxxx leaving the scene of an accident (personal injury), xxxxxxxx Operating MV after xxxxxxxxxxx Revocation. Officer xxxxxxx issued xxxxxxx xxxxx Uniform Mass Citation for both charges, (Citation # xxxxxxxx).

Officer xxxxxxx inspected the van and did not find any damages. The van was then released to xxxxx xxxxxxxx friend xxxxxx xxxxxx (xxx# xxxxxxxxx).

Officer Wood (xxxxx) responded to Blue HIll Ave and xxxxxx Street to meet with xxxxxxx xxxxx (victim), who stated that he attempted to cross the street and his front tire collided with the right rear part of the motor vehicle which he then stated caused him to fall on his left shoulder. xxxxxxx xxxxx stated that he was not injured and denied medical attention.

Officer Wood also met xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx (witness) who stated that he worked for American Ambulance and was on duty at the time of the incident on ambulance xxx. xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx
